hyp: State-owned enterprises and dominant private enterprises entered the old revolutionary areas of southern Jiangxi.

From 26 to 27 September, in order to further expand the educational achievements on the theme of "Remember the first heart, remember the mission", the Central Office for Civil-Military Integration, the State Bureau of National Defense Science and Industry, and the All-China Federation of Industry and Commerce jointly organized a survey on "State-owned enterprises and dominant private enterprises entering the old revolutionary areas in southern Jiangxi".

Jin Zhuang Long, Deputy Director of the Central Office for Civil-Military Integration, Xu Lejiang, Deputy Secretary of the Communist Party Group and Deputy Chairman of the All-China Federation of Industry and Commerce, Zhang Kejian, Deputy Secretary of the Jiangxi Provincial Committee and Li Bingjun, Secretary of the Ganzhou Municipal Committee, participated in the investigation.

Among the enterprises participating in the research activities are China Aerospace Science and Technology Group Co., Ltd., 8 military industrial groups, Hunan Rare Earth Materials Research Institute, 10 state-owned enterprises of Minkou and 15 dominant private enterprises, such as Zhenxiang Group.

During this period, the researchers visited the Memorial Garden of the Long March of the Central Red Army, remembered the revolutionary martyrs, received the traditional education of the revolution, reviewed the difficult process of the Long March of the Red Army, investigated seven enterprises and one testing center in Ganzhou, held symposiums, and concluded eight cooperation projects and signed contracts on the spot.
In the research activities symposium, Ganzhou City introduced its unique industrial advantages, to the participating enterprises to introduce high-quality projects.

In a statement delivered on behalf of the Military Industry Corporation, Minkou State-owned enterprises, private enterprises and local enterprises, China Weapons Industry Corporation Limited, China Steel Research Technology Group Co., Ltd., Xi'an Tianhe Defense Technology Co., Ltd., and Jiangxi Jinli Permanent Magnetic Science and Technology Co., Ltd., respectively, said that they will continue to strengthen the demand docking work between state-owned enterprises, dominant private enterprises and Jiangxi Province and Ganzhou City, gradually broaden the areas of cooperation, help industrial transformation and upgrade, and promote high-quality development in the old revolutionary areas.

Through this research activity, we have gained a better understanding of the unique industrial development advantages of the old revolutionary areas in southern Jiangxi, defined the key tasks for the economic and social development of the old revolutionary areas at the present stage, strengthened the belief that state-owned and private enterprises should serve the people and start their own businesses.
Beijing market supervision department to carry out comprehensive law enforcement before the basic stability of commodity prices

BEIJING, Sept. 27 (Xinhua) -- To strengthen market supervision and law enforcement before the festival, the Beijing Municipal Administration of Market Supervision inspected more than 2,000 households of various business entities on the eve of the National Day.

The inspection showed that the market sold sufficient supplies of grain, oil, meat, fruit, vegetables, custard and other necessities of life, commodity prices were basically stable, no serious violations of laws and regulations were found, and the market operating order was generally stable.

Today, reporters learned from the Beijing Municipal Administration of Market Supervision that the bureau has launched a "comprehensive law enforcement inspection day" in the city, focusing on key areas, such as price, industry and commerce, quality supervision, food and medicine, business, and all other elements of law enforcement inspection.

According to the introduction, the Beijing Municipal Market Supervision Bureau price, industry and commerce, quality supervision, medicine, commerce and other five law enforcement teams coordinated, close cooperation, led by the heads of various law enforcement agencies, groups to randomly selected parts of the business entities for joint law enforcement inspection.
During the inspection, law enforcement officials focused on price behavior, advertising, food safety, measurement standards and production safety systems.

The district market regulatory bureaus have also organized simultaneous joint law-enforcement inspections, involving more than 1,600 law-enforcement personnel and more than 2,000 households of various business entities. The inspections showed that the supply of basic necessities such as grain, oil, meat, fruit, vegetables and custard sold on the market was adequate, commodity prices were basically stable, business operators were able to operate in compliance with the law, no serious violations were found, and market business order was generally stable.

The Beijing Municipal Administration of Market Supervision said that during the National Day period, it will strengthen emergency duty, continuously carry out inspection and inspection of the market, deal with all kinds of market supervision issues quickly according to law, and deal with illegal business activities reported by the people, once verified, will be dealt with seriously according to law and earnestly protect the legitimate rights and interests of consumers.
Royal Cambodian Academy of Sciences Confucius Institute "China in My Heart" Chinese Essay Competition unveiled

The award ceremony was held at the Confucius Institute of the Royal Cambodian Academy of Sciences on the 26th day of the "China in My Heart" Chinese Essay Competition on the theme of the 70th anniversary of New China.

The award was presented by the Ambassador of China to Cambodia, Zhong Jianfa, a representative of the Cambodian National Council, and Wei Siyu, President of the Jiangxi Chamber of Commerce of Cambodia.

According to Chai Keqing, the Chinese president of the Confucius Institute of the Royal Cambodian Academy of Sciences, the competition lasted for two months and was attended by Cambodian primary and secondary school students (including students with special education) and university students (including social workers).

Diplomats from the Chinese Embassy in Cambodia presented certificates of appreciation to Lin Weicai, the first prize winner of the university group, and Guo Lina, the first prize winner of the primary and secondary school group.

According to Chai, the entries were divided into groups of universities and primary and secondary schools. Senior Cambodian Chinese experts were invited to form a judging committee to select the first prize, the second prize, the third prize, and the tenth prize.
Lin Wei, the first prize winner of the university group, said that he had been learning Chinese for 15 years and had made a huge impact on himself.
We hope that the younger generation will continue to add to the friendship between China and Cambodia.
The picture shows the guest and the winning contestant.

Guo Lina, winner of the first prize in the primary and secondary school category, said that as an overseas Chinese, there was a different excitement about the opportunity to express the feelings of "China in my heart" and win the prize through the Chinese language.
Organizers said the competition had not only created a positive atmosphere in China-Cambodia relations, but also attracted more and more Cambodian students to study Chinese and study in China.

26 (Xinhua) -- Iran has begun using advanced centrifuges to accelerate the production of enriched uranium, in further violation of the 2015 nuclear agreement with world powers, the United Nations International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) said Thursday.
The IAEA report states that advanced centrifuges at Iran's Natanz Nuclear Facility “are accumulating or are ready to accumulate enriched uranium ”.
Since US President Donald Trump pulled out of the nuclear deal last May and imposed sanctions on Iran, Iran is gradually violating the limits of the 2015 nuclear deal with major powers.
The agreement stipulates that Iran can only refine uranium using first-generation IR-1 centrifuges.
Other signatories to the deal, Britain, China, France, Germany and Russia, have been trying to salvage it, but Tehran has repeatedly accused Europe of not doing enough.

According to Kyodo news agency, Japanese Foreign Minister Toshiyuki Mogi held talks with Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov in New York on the afternoon of April 25, confirming the conclusion of a peace treaty that includes the territorial issues of the four northern islands (the disputed islands of Japan and Russia) and the development of bilateral relations in a wide range of political and economic fields.
This was the first time that Maoki had held consultations with Russia as head of the negotiations leading to the conclusion of a peace treaty.
Mr Mogi told the Russian side that he "wants to see real negotiations, including the promotion of common economic activities [in the four northern islands]".
According to the Japanese government, the talks did not discuss the territorial issue in detail.
At the December 2018 summit, the two foreign ministers agreed to accelerate negotiations.
At the meeting, the two foreign ministers welcomed the progress made in consultations on joint economic activities in the fields of tourism and waste disposal.
"Hopefully, the successful implementation will lead to the next step," he said, referring to the tourism pilot scheduled for October.
In addition, the talks confirmed Lavrov's visit to Japan in November to coincide with the G20 foreign ministers' meeting in Nagoya.
Tuionetoa was elected as the new Prime Minister of Tonga.

Nuku'alofa: The parliament of the South Pacific island nation of Tonga has elected the current Minister of Finance and National Planning, Bohiva Tuionetoa, as Tonga's new prime minister, replacing Akilisi Bohiwa, who died of illness earlier this month.
The Tongan Parliament is unicameral and consists of 26 members, according to the main Tongan media website MATANGI.
In a parliamentary vote on the same day, Tuianetoa was elected with 23 votes, defeating the rival Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Infrastructure and Tourism, Semisi Sika.
Tonga is a constitutional monarchy with a separation of powers between the executive, legislative and judicial branches.
Tuionetoa is also subject to appointment by the king.
The next Tongan parliamentary elections will be held in 2021.
The women's volleyball team is expected to defend the World Cup ahead of schedule!
In a match against the Dutch women's volleyball team on the 27th, the Chinese team won two games in a row before being pulled back to a city by their opponents.
The World Cup is drawing to a close, and while defending the title is in sight, the Chinese women's volleyball team is still not to be taken lightly against Serbia.

In the first two sets of the match against the Netherlands, the Chinese women's volleyball team was as strong as ever, going down 25: 19, 25: 16, until the third set, when the team suffered a setback.

The Dutch women's volleyball team in the backward situation to strengthen the offensive serve, the Chinese team received a shock, and the girls attack the heart, the number of mistakes began to increase, and finally 21: 25 was the opponent back to a city.
Lang Ping said in an interview after the game: "The third game, because of errors we sent about eight points."

Of course, the strength of the Dutch women's volleyball team is not to be underestimated, the Chinese women's volleyball team also prepared for the difficulties before the game, although lost a game, but everything is still in Lang Ping grasp, "with the strong team to win the game is normal, playing five games is normal, so we say to the players to focus," Lang Ping said.
In the fourth game, the players were actively adjusted, Zhang Changning in the offensive end of the fire, a single game to gain 8 points, for the team to win.

There are only two rounds left in the 11-round competition so far, and the Chinese women's volleyball team has already touched the trophy with one hand, but it was a wake-up call for the Chinese women's volleyball team in their match against the Netherlands: the more critical the moment, the more it will be.

In another match on the 27th, Russia and the United States failed to take all three points from their opponents, allowing the Chinese women's volleyball team to defend their title one round ahead of schedule by taking all three points against Serbia.
All sorts of things are developing in favor of the Chinese women's volleyball team.
However, the absence of all six of Serbia's main players does not mean they will give China three points easily.

In their current form, Serbia have largely missed out on medals, which means they can "light up" against China's women's volleyball team and put their weight behind them, while China, under pressure to win the title, is likely to experience ups and downs.
In addition, the substitute Serbian team was not the "lambs", after a five-game series with the Netherlands, Serbia 2 team in the final 3 – 2 reversal of the Netherlands, the depth of the squad.

Before the start of the third stage, Lang Ping also said that neither the Dutch team nor the Japanese team will be able to cope: "Osaka will be very difficult, we have to continue to prepare seriously."
Now the trumpet of defending the title has been blown, and the game has really entered the "white-hot phase."

On the strength of the lineup, the Chinese women's volleyball team is above the opponent, only the last critical moment, but also to see if the girls can play a normal level, on the court to free themselves.

The University of Macao today (27) hosted the "Second Macao Stem Cell Symposium", which attracted more than 100 experts and scholars from the United States, Singapore, Mainland China, Hong Kong and Macao to share and discuss the latest technology and development of stem cell research with students and teachers of Macao universities.
The Vice-Chancellor (Research) of the University of Macau, Mr David Ge Wei, said stem cell research was of medical value and one of the key research projects of the University.

As a leading international university on the west coast of the Greater Bay Area, HKU is committed to building a talent training base and technology innovation centre on the west coast of the Greater Bay Area.
The seminar brought together experts in stem cell research at home and abroad to share the latest technology, which will help promote stem cell research and development in Macao.
The Director of the University's School of Health Sciences, Mr Tang Chu Xia, said the University had continued to enhance its research innovation and transformation in recent years.
At the conference, leading scholars shared cutting-edge knowledge and technology in stem cell research.

Ji Weizhi, Academician of the Chinese Academy of Sciences and Dean of the Primate Transformation School of Yunnan Kunming University of Science and Technology, explained the process and molecular mechanism of studying monkeys and human embryos in vitro using a 3D culture system; Jing Naihe, Researcher of the Shanghai Institute of Biochemical Cells of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, explained the temporal and temporal changes of cell lineage and tissue after implantation of mouse embryos from a single cell and molecular level; and Wang Yong, Professor of the University of Pennsylvania, showed how to use biomaterial hydrogel to simulate a stem cell micronest for survival and transport.

Xu Renhe, Associate Dean (Research) of the School of Health Sciences of the University of Australia, Chen Guokai, Assistant Dean, and Wang Chunming, Associate Professor of the Chinese Academy of Medicine of the University of Australia, also presented the latest important results.

Organized by the Faculty of Health Sciences of the University of Macau and co-sponsored by the Institute of Chinese Medicine of the University of Macau and the State Key Laboratory of Chinese Quality Research of the University of Science and Technology of Macao, the Second Macao Stem Cell Symposium was attended by Chen Ko'an, Acting Senior Manager of the Macao Science and Technology Development Fund.

The symposium consisted of 11 presentations on embryonic development and tissue production, translational medicine, mechanism research and transformation applications of stem cells, and biomaterials and applications.
There was a lively atmosphere and participants actively discussed and shared the latest research and views on relevant technologies.
Mr Tsui said the symposium had provided a platform for stem cell experts from the Greater Bay Area and other regions to exchange and collaborate with each other.
The National Medal of the People's Republic of China and the National Medal of Honor will be presented at a solemn ceremony.

With the approval of the CPC Central Committee, the ceremony for the conferment of the State Medal and State Honor of the People's Republic of China will be held on September 29 at 10 a.m. in the Great Hall of the People.

XI Jinping, general secretary of the Communist Party of China (CPC) Central Committee and chairman of the Central Military Commission (CMC), will present the "Order of the Republic", "Order of Friendship" and "National Medal of Honor" to the recipients of the state medals and make important speeches.

With the approval of the CPC Central Committee, the ceremony of conferring the State Medal and State Honor of the People's Republic of China will be held at 10 a.m. on September 29 at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing.
This is the Order of the Republic.

The "Order of the Republic" is made of red and gold, with the national emblem, the five-pointed star, the Yellow River, the Yangtze River, the peaks and peonies as the emblem, and the Chinese knot, the Ru Yi and the orchid as the emblem.
This is the Order of Friendship.

The Order of Friendship is handmade in gold and blue, with peace dove, earth, handshake, lotus flower and other elements in the body, and Chinese knots, evergreen, peony, jade and orchid in the chain.
This is the National Medal of Honor.

The National Medal of Honor is mainly in red and gold hues, with five stars, Tiananmen, peonies, flags and lights in its body, and Chinese knots and flowers in its chain. It is made of cold-pressed molding, filament inlaying and enamel in its entirety. It symbolizes the great contributions made by the recipients of the National Medal of Honor in various fields, demonstrates the leading role of demonstration, inspires the people of all ethnic groups in China to remember their first heart, remember their mission and work tirelessly for the realization of the Chinese dream of the great rejuvenation of the Chinese nation.

The award ceremony will be broadcast live on the Central Television and Radio Station, Xinhua Net, People's Net, CCTV Network, China Net and other key central news sites, as well as the People's Daily Client, Xinhua News Agency Client, CCTV News Client and other new media platforms.
"For 70 years, NATO's containment and defense measures have been based on maintaining technological superiority," Stoltenberg said in a speech at the U.S. Military Academy at West Point.
But times are changing, he says.
"We are encountering increasing competition," Stoltenberg said.
We should therefore redouble our efforts now to be sure that no one will surpass us.
"Some of the new technologies were not developed by NATO members, but in authoritarian countries," he said.
Chinese companies are working on 5G networks.
Russia is developing an independent Internet and investing heavily in the next generation of weapons, such as hypersonic missiles. ”
Stoltenberg said NATO's future security "depends on the ability to understand, accept and apply the latest advanced technology."

On September 24, "a boat ticket to take me to see" the charity activities held in Changsha Orange Island, more than 100 disabled people from Changsha were invited to board the Orange Star cruise to enjoy the magnificent scenery of Xiangjiang River and celebrate the 70th anniversary of the founding of New China.
Most of the more than 100 people with disabilities who attended the event boarded the cruise for the first time.
Zhao Zhengang, 56, is a physically handicapped man who rarely goes out because his feet are immobile.
"Today, for the first time on a cruise ship, I enjoyed the spectacular sight of the Xiang River and felt the pulse of the development of Changsha.
Volunteers from the Changsha City Fukang Social Work Service Center and the Blue Sky Rescue Team provided a nuanced service for the disabled.
Especially for those with severe physical disabilities, volunteers will carry them on cruises.

In the past 70 years, with the support of the Party and the government, the cause of persons with disabilities in Changsha has made continuous progress, with more and more persons with disabilities becoming genuine participants, contributors and beneficiaries of social and economic development.

Jilin Kindergarten's Environmental Protection Concept Begins with Baby
On the 27th, a kindergarten in Jilin City, Jilin Province, launched a garbage sorting education class, teaching young children to distinguish recyclable garbage from other types of garbage.
It is reported that this is the first time garbage classification into the local preschool education classes.
A few days ago, nine departments of Jilin Province jointly issued the "Jilin Province to promote the classification of municipal waste disposal work plan."
In 2019, on the basis of the pilot of the mandatory classification of household waste in Changchun, the province decided to carry out the classification of household waste in prefecture-level cities.
The city of Jilin is one of them.
We hope that through this activity, we can realize the effect of driving families with children and society with kindergartens and promote the concept of environmental protection.
Hosting the event Hi Fan International Kindergarten Executive Director Liu Lijuan said.
On the same day, the director of the garden read out the environmental initiative, hope that the garbage sorting from children.
After the children performed the "Low Carbon Babe" dance, the group played a game of garbage sorting.
The tutor also handed out "recyclable" "other trash" stickers, advising children to go home, stick the stickers on the trash cans and record videos.
Liu Lijuan introduced, the kindergarten has been advocating low-carbon, green concept of environmental protection, the regular opening of environmental lecture hall.
In addition, a sortable garbage can has been set up in the garbage disposal area of the park, which is marked with the type of waste.
Teachers teach children what is recyclable
According to preliminary statistics, the city of Jilin produced about 546.52 million tons of domestic waste in 2018, all of which were disposed of in domestic waste disposal sites.
Of these, 3.2929 million tons were disposed of in sanitary landfills, 2.0923 million tons were incinerated, and 80,100 tons were treated by comprehensive utilization processes.
After years of efforts, every city and county in the province has the ability to dispose of household waste harmlessly.

The Jilin Provincial Work Program for Promoting the Classification and Handling of Municipal Domestic Waste at the Local Level, which has been issued, explicitly calls for further activities such as sorting garbage into schools, teaching materials and classrooms, and strengthening the interaction between students and parents through the creation of songs, ballads, cartoons, microvideos, etc., in order to "educate a child, influence a family, promote a community, and train a new generation".
Mazda released figures on September 27 showing global sales of 117,015 vehicles in August.
Sales in China fell 21 per cent as a result of a lack of new vehicles and reduced prices.
Domestic sales fell 6%, and demand for the last shuttle bus was limited before the consumer tax hike in October.
Mazda sold 17,729 vehicles in China in August.
In August 2018, sales were down 13% from the previous year.
Sales of China's flagship SUV, the CX-4, were down 14%.
The CX-4 "s 2016 launch has been a long time in the past, with the new car's effectiveness declining.
As a result of the long-term perspective to improve the brand value of the strategy to reduce prices, it is also known to have a large impact on sales.
Mazda's U.S. sales rose 7% year-on-year to 27,482 vehicles, a 14-month increase.
Sales of SUVs such as the CX-5 were boosted in August by a day more sales than a year earlier, coupled with "increased promotional activity such as the Mazda."
Domestic sales fell 6 per cent to 14,422 vehicles.
The company said the emergency pre-tax rush "did not go as far as it did last time [in 2014]."
Sales of small cars such as the "Demio" were down.
Chirac's political legacy lives on
French President Jacques Chirac died at the age of 86.
At a time when the world is in the midst of a century of unprecedented change, the French politician ’ s political legacy is still worthy of praise.
Chirac was president of France for 12 years in a charismatic manner.
He inherited the independent diplomatic spirit of Charles de Gaulle and firmly supported European integration.
At the same time, he was a strong advocate of world multipolarity and multilateralism and a statesman with a strategic vision.
For this reason, the French press described him as "an outstanding representative of France on the world stage".
One of Chirac ’ s favorite political decisions was to oppose the American-led war in Iraq.
Under his leadership, France joined forces with Germany to resist American pressure and lead the anti-war front.
A year after the war, he predicted that the war in Iraq would lead to increased terror and make the world more dangerous.
Chirac ’ s warning proved to be correct.

At a time when European integration is in limbo and American unilateralism is on the rise, Chirac ’ s strategic thinking and choices about international politics and global affairs are undoubtedly instructive.
Chirac was also a French politician who made the Chinese feel familiar and affectionate.
He was one of the initiators and creators of the “Golden Decade ” of China-France relations, which began in 1995 when he was first elected President of France.
In 2004, China and France established a comprehensive strategic partnership, and China-France bilateral exchanges have entered a new stage.
During Chirac's administration, bilateral trade between China and France grew rapidly, and the two countries made breakthroughs in cooperation in aviation, nuclear energy and railway transportation.
Chirac initiative of the Sino-French cultural year, created a new cultural exchange model in the history of Sino-French.
Chirac's lifelong love of Chinese culture is particularly impressive.
According to Chinese diplomats who know him, Chirac can recite poems by Li Bai and Du Fu, and even accurately judge the history of Chinese bronzes.
"Not to see the pyramids is not really to Egypt, not to see the terracotta warriors is not really to China" - this golden sentence from Chirac.

"The West has concerns about China's political and social development, the ecological issues arising from China's economic growth and China's political status in the world," Chirac told Xinhua in an exclusive interview.
But I personally have confidence in China.

I believe that China is a country with a long history of civilization, and its experience is sufficient to help it establish the concepts and values for harmonious development and to shoulder its responsibilities on the world stage for a long time to come.
I also believe that China's renaissance will bring new creative vitality to world culture and enrich it.
The Sri Lankans are gone, but Chirac's political legacy and message to the world will endure.

The 7th China Computer Society Big Data Academic Conference was held in Wuhan on May 27. Nearly 1,000 experts and industry leaders in the field of big data research focused on the hot research issues of big data and explained the technological process of big data in the age of artificial intelligence.

Sponsored by the China Computer Society (CCF), the CCF Committee of Big Data Experts and Huazhong University of Science and Technology jointly organized 5 invited reports and 188 forum reports, and set up 33 thematic technology and industry sub-forums to exchange and discuss research results on Big Data Foundation Theory, Big Data Education, Big Data Visualization, Big Data Finance and Science and Technology.

The CCF Academic Conference on Big Data aims to strengthen contacts and exchanges between domestic and foreign scholars in the field of big data, and promote interdisciplinary convergence and the development of the big data industry.
Formed Members of the Legislative Council of the HKSAR Join the Opposition to the Bill

Members of the Legislative Council of the Hong Kong SAR issued a joint statement on the 27th, expressing strong opposition to the passage of the "Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Bill 2019" by the Foreign Affairs Committee of both houses of the United States Congress.

The statement, co-authored by 40 pro-establishment legislators, said Hong Kong currently enjoys the rights conferred by the Basic Law of the HKSAR, including the right to maintain the status of a free trade port and a separate customs territory, to enter into and implement bilateral and multilateral agreements with different countries and regions in the name of "Hong Kong, China" in the fields of economy, finance, shipping, trade, communications, tourism, culture and sports.
These rights are not granted by any foreign government or legislature.

Hong Kong has always strictly abided by international agreements, international rules, laws and business ethics, and has participated in a wide range of cooperation activities with different countries and regions.

The statement said the move by the U.S. House and Senate Foreign Affairs Committee to pass the bill was unnecessary and was merely a response to a call by its agents to intervene violently in Hong Kong's internal affairs and gain political leverage for their agents in Hong Kong.
Members of the establishment expressed deep regret and strong opposition to the move.
The statement noted that Hong Kong is an important trading partner of the United States and the source of the largest trade surplus.
Hong Kong's good rule of law, fair and free business environment and clean society make it a good location for American businessmen to do business.
If the United States passes this bill, it will not only hurt Hong Kong's interests and those of the United States, but also make Sino-US relations worse.
The statement said Hong Kong will, as always, unswervingly implement the principle of "one country, two systems" and continue to enjoy the rights and fulfill its obligations under the Basic Law.
Hong Kong will continue to make its due contribution to the international community and to international trade in the past, present and future.
26 (Xinhua) -- Both houses of the French parliament will discuss immigration policy reform next week, according to the European Times.
French President Emmanuel Macron recently said that France could not “accommodate everyone, ” but at the same time was trying to“ accommodate everyone. ”
According to the report, Macron is trying to find a middle ground on immigration to soften the impact of the upcoming debate.

In a recent interview on the sidelines of the General Assembly ’ s general debate in New York, Macron expressed the hope that there would be a genuine “two-pronged ” approach to immigration policy, balancing humanitarianism with efficiency.
Macron said: "If France wants to be able to take in (migrants) properly, it cannot take in everyone."

Macron listed four priorities for immigration policy: to grant asylum to refugees in need of protection as soon as possible; to promote the integration of migrants more efficiently; to receive and protect all migrants entering French territory; and to resettle more efficiently those who entered France illegally and are not suitable to stay.
Whether illegal immigrants should be protected by the state medical aid system has been the subject of much debate.
Macron said he would like to be able to “evaluate ” the system, but not eliminate it, but limit it.
Following Macron ’ s remarks, Le Pen, leader of the far-right National Alliance, tweeted that Macron ’ s statement was “empty talk. ”

Right-wing Republicans, including Senate President Richard Ruschel, also argued that immigration policy should be discussed in a “conciliatory ” but“ realistic ” manner, indirectly criticizing Macron.
Varao, a leftist Socialist MP, argued that France should “embrace more and better ” on immigration, and criticized Macron for“ manipulating ” the issue.
A year after its enactment, the new Asylum and Immigration Act has divided opinion within the ruling party but failed to placate the right-wing opposition, the report said.

In the next general election, in 2022, the topic of immigration policy will again be the focus of far-right attacks, and Macron will need to do something about it, but at the risk of angering the ruling party ’ s inner left.
The lower house of the French National Assembly will reportedly debate immigration policy from 30 September and the Senate from 2 October.
There are signs that China's A-shares are in the midst of a buy-back boom, with many listed companies offering to buy back their shares in real gold and silver.

According to financial data service provider Oriental Wealth, the total amount of repurchase carried out by A-share listed companies in 2019 has exceeded 100 billion yuan (RMB, the same below), far exceeding the previous year's figures and setting a record for the amount of A-share repurchase funds.

In response, Xu Yang, chairman of Shanghai-based Mykolong Information Consulting Co. Ltd., said the low overall valuation of the A-share market this year and the use of relatively low prices to buy back shares are conducive to listed companies to improve the efficiency of the use of funds, reflect the willingness of listed companies to actively manage market capitalization and ample cash flow, helping to boost investor confidence.
In addition, the continuous improvement of the share repurchase system, also promoted listed companies actively share repurchase.
For example, at the beginning of this year, the Shanghai Stock Exchange and Shenzhen Stock Exchange issued detailed rules for the implementation of share repurchase by listed companies.

According to the media statistics, the listed companies that have implemented the buy-back program this year are mainly in the infrastructure, real estate, information technology and electronic equipment industries.
In addition, in terms of repurchase payments, six listed companies have repurchased more than 1 billion yuan this year.
At the top of the list was Yili shares, which were repurchased for more than $5 billion.
What impact will a listed company's share buyback have on the market?

Zhao Xijun, vice dean of the School of Finance and Finance at Renmin University of China, told China News Agency that the buyback shows that listed companies have strong economic strength and good financial position, and are able to maintain the stability of stock prices and give investors confidence.
The former is based on the company's good operating performance, the latter requires the listed company and its controlling shareholders to have higher quality.
For capital markets, these are the core fundamentals.
Buying back shares of listed companies helps to boost investor confidence and has a supporting effect on the stock prices of listed companies.

According to the Oriental Securities Research Report, based on the estimated number of share repurchases by A-share listed companies as a whole since the beginning of this year, and the average price of the shares already repurchased, the incremental capital generated by the repurchase of A-share market this year is expected to exceed 150 billion yuan.

In the past two months, the State key cultural protection unit Tianjin Tianhau Palace large-scale mural "Tin Hau Temple" restoration work was announced on the 26th, will be reopened this year during the National Day.
The Temple of Heaven is a large traditional fresco that fully reflects the life of Mazu.
It was painted by Cai Changkui, director of the former Tianjin Folk Museum (Tianhau Palace) from 1991 to 1994.

It is understood that this mural was painted on the north and south walls of the main hall of the Temple of Heaven, 32 meters in length, 2.6 meters in height, divided into two parts, using more than 30 stories, such as the birth of the queen, the crossing of the sea, and the ascension of the feather, 358 characters reproduced the life story of Mazu.
Cai Changkui said that in recent years, Tianjin's rainy summers and dry winters have led to the rupture of the frescoes, which account for 60% of the total area.

In order to protect and save the mural of Mazu, the Management Committee of Ancient Culture Street in Nankai District of Tianjin City and the Temple of Heaven initiated the restoration of the Temple of Heaven and the Temple fresco.
The restoration project was led by Cai Changkui and involved four famous Chinese painters.

The restoration work is based on the principle of "repair as old as the old", while the original fresco has been made local content adjustments, the original fresco is not perfect to carry out supplementary restoration.
In the restoration, we also made innovations and experimentation in color, materials, pen and ink.
After restoration, the original frescoes were preserved in style, spirituality, spirit and artistic style.
Built in 1326, it is the oldest building in the city of Tianjin and one of the earliest Mazu temples in China.
On September 25, the opening ceremony of Beijing Daxing International Airport was held.
Beijing Daxing International Airport Terminal in the shape of the "Phoenix wings", known as the "Seven Wonders of the New World" first.

Beijing Capital International Airport is already overloaded, carrying 100 million + passengers last year, making it the second airport in the world to handle more than 100 million passengers a year after Atlanta.
Beijing Daxing International Airport is expected to handle 45 million passengers and 20% of international flights by 2022, and 72 million passengers and 30% of international flights by 2025.
As a "new country", how cool is it?
Beijing Daxing International Airport is located between Daxing District of Beijing and Guangyang District of Langfang City, Hebei Province.
The roof of the terminal has a projected floor area of 180,000 m2 and is the size of 25 standard football pitches.

Beijing Daxing International Airport is the first airport in the world to have two arrival levels and two departure levels – F1-F4 for international arrivals, domestic arrivals, domestic departures and international departures.
It is connected to the airport by a double-decker bridge, which corresponds to the F3 and F4 terminals, respectively.
The first flight of Beijing Daxing International Airport ushered in the "double airport" era in Beijing.
At present, 66 airlines are interested in entering Beijing Daxing International Airport, including 20 domestic airlines, 46 Hong Kong, Macao, Taiwan and foreign airlines.
In the winter and spring of 2019, Beijing Daxing International Airport is expected to open 116 routes, including 101 domestic routes and 15 international routes.

This and Beijing Capital International Airport form a coordinated development, moderate competition, international first-class competitive "dual hub" airport pattern, not only alleviates the capacity saturation of the capital airport operating pressure, but also can better meet the urgent need of rapid growth of air transport in Beijing and the surrounding areas, effectively enhance the international competitiveness of China's civil aviation industry.

In order to ensure efficiency and quality, Beijing Daxing International Airport takes full account of its geographical location, the relationship between the airport and the surrounding airspace and operating environment.

For the first time, domestic airports of this size have adopted the localized baggage automatic processing and information management system, adopting the innovative baggage transfer mode to improve the efficiency of baggage handling system.
Beijing Daxing International Airport, the first flight, the phoenix wings show off cool take-off.

This new airport, which is the first of more than 40 international and domestic airports and has a domestic production rate of over 98%, will have direct and indirect economic impact on the industries in the surrounding areas and inject vitality into Beijing's economic development.
MCA Tentative November Conference Proposed to Introduce Party Age to 16
In early November, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (MCA) decided to lower the age of admission to the party to 16.

Following the adoption of the lower voting age by the National Assembly, MCA announced that it would hold its 66th Central Congress this year to propose changes to the party constitution, including lowering the age of MCA membership from 18 to 16.

Ma Hua Central Committee had been due to hold the Central Congress on 2 and 3 November this year, but the date of the congress may be changed due to the by-election for the parliamentary seat of Tanjung Biai, said Dato 'Seri Wei Jiaxiang, president of the MCA.

He said that since the Electoral Commission would not meet until 1 October to finalize the nomination date and polling day for the by-election for the seat of Tanjung Bi, they would meet the following day, 2 October, to discuss whether to change the date of this year's Central Congress.

He also explained that the purpose of the CNC meeting yesterday (26) was to set the date for the congress and to amend the party constitution, but only just happened to be on the agenda of the by-election for the seat of the Indigenous Unity Party when the MP for Tanjung Biai, Dato 'Mohd.
List of counties in Shandong Province List of counties in Shandong Province List of counties in Shandong Province
Wang Boxiang, Shandong Shouguang, born in February 1943, joined the work in 1967, successively served as township party secretary, county party secretary, mayor, and so on.
In 1986, Wang Boxiang was appointed party secretary of Shouguang County, Shandong Province, when Shouguang was the poor county of Weifang.

During his five years in office, Wang Boxiang concentrated his efforts on three things: first, to promote the industrialization of vegetables; second, to develop the salt and alkali flats in Shoubei; and third, to lay the foundation for the industrial transformation, so that Shouguang people would henceforth bulge their pockets and erect their waists.
Shouguang farmers have a tradition of growing vegetables, but also a lesson in growing vegetables.
In the early 1980s, Shouguang farmers had a bumper crop of vegetables that they could not sell and rotted in the fields.
Wang Boxiang investigation found that the key to catch vegetables is to do a good circulation.
Shouguang first established the vegetable wholesale market, opened the prelude to the development of the market economy.
Party members and cadres should take the lead, messed up, all losses in the county to bear.
In 1989, with the support of Wang Boxiang, 17 members of the Sanyuan Zhu Village Wang Leyi set up 17 winter warm vegetable huts.
In the first year, more than 5,000 vegetable sheds were built, and the vegetable sheds spread throughout the county and the country.
For thousands of years, Shoubei 1.6 million mu of land in addition to salt and alkaline beach, is shallow beach.
The local people live a very hard life.
Shounan has a vegetable shed, Shoubei how to do?
Wang Boxiang organized tens of thousands of people to stage a general battle and set up camp on the barren alkali beach for forty or fifty days.
At that time, Shoubei developed 150,000 mu of shrimp ponds, 200,000 mu of salt fields, 600,000 mu of cotton fields, and developed a "treasure pot" on the salt and alkali beaches.
In July 1986, Wang participated in the Weifang Industrial Conference for the first time as the county party secretary.
During the meeting, issued a "Weifang twelve counties industrial economic figures comparison table", at first glance, the total industrial output value, longevity is good, ranked fourth.
But if the original salt is removed, Shouguang's pure industrial output is only 119 million yuan, ranking third.
Wang Boxiang with more than 70 people to take the group, run to the field "brain change."
Less than a year later, the county invested 150 million yuan in 77 projects.
Since then, they have organized "study tours" to Shenzhen, Dongguan and Shanghai.
Shouguang lack of enterprises, more lack of entrepreneurs.
The board was chaired by Wang Boxiang, who publicly selected the director of the factory in the county, and 40 "enterprising talents" were promoted to the front line of the industry.
In 1991, Shouguang joined the ranks of the top 100 counties in China, and Wang was transferred to Weifang as deputy mayor.

He left behind more than 200,000 vegetable sheds, 1.2 million mu of cotton fields, salt fields and shrimp ponds, 4,854 enterprises, more than 100,000 "million yuan households", a cadre recognized by the people.

On September 26, State Councilor and Foreign Minister Wang Yi chaired the Foreign Ministers' Meeting of China and African Member States of the Security Council at the United Nations Headquarters in New York.
The Ministers for Foreign Affairs of Côte d'Ivoire, Equatorial Guinea, Equatorial Guinea, South Africa, Niger and Tunisia attended the meeting.
Wang Yi made four suggestions on strengthening China-Africa cooperation in the Security Council.
First, by uniting our strength.

Unilateralism is the biggest challenge in the current international situation.As a direct consequence, the basic norms governing international relations are being challenged and the role of the United Nations is being undermined, to the detriment of the interests of the vast number of developing countries, small and medium-sized countries, including African countries.
To meet this challenge, China and Africa need to stand shoulder to shoulder in solidarity.
In the Security Council, when the three African countries speak with one voice, the weight of the focus is not just three votes, but the entire African continent.
By standing together, China and Africa will not be just four votes, but will lead others to follow, influence and shape the Council's agenda.
Since 2018, China has established the "3 + 1" coordination mechanism with the African members of the Security Council.
Second, resolve disputes through consultation.

China has always advocated political settlement of hotspot issues.Africa has a good tradition of consultation and experience of successful mediation by African regional and sub-regional organizations.
Many of the complex dilemmas on the Council's agenda, particularly in Africa, are mostly the bane of colonialism, or are directly related to external factors.
We should make good use of Chapter VI of the UN Charter and give full play to the role of the UN in mediation.
Third, self-improvement through self-reliance.
African countries and peoples know Africa's problems best, and Africa has the ability and wisdom to solve them.

In dealing with African hotspot issues, the Council should focus on listening to and respecting the will of Africa, should play the role of regional and subregional organizations, and should encourage and support endogenous solutions from Africa.
China is ready to strengthen coordination with Africa and resolutely promote capacity building of African independent peace operations.
Fourth, it is essential to rule by development.
China and the vast number of African countries are all developing countries. We must give top priority to economic and social development and support each other's development path.

China is ready to work closely with the African Union's Agenda 2063, the United Nations 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development and African countries' development strategies to help African countries enhance their capacity for development and eliminate the root causes of conflict.
We should jointly urge the United Nations to increase its investment in Africa's development.

China has provided and will continue to provide assistance to the best of its ability and is ready to coordinate actions with African countries, mobilize the United Nations and WHO to step up their assistance and play the role of the United Nations Stabilization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo.
Neonatology and other relays to save small lives.
Thrilling!
The expectant mother had an early attack, and on her way to the hospital, a 32-week premature baby was born in her father's car.
Fortunately for obstetrics and neonatal pediatricians, the relay saved his life.

Coincidentally, on the 19th, 20th and 21st, the Obstetrics and Neonatology Department of Hubei Provincial Maternal and Child Health Hospital received three premature babies on the road on three consecutive days, and the other two were born on the 120 ambulance, both at 29 weeks.
At 7 a.m. on Sept. 19, Ms. Cheng, a mother of two, felt a little pain in her stomach. She thought she was 32 weeks pregnant and that her first baby was premature.
At 9: 30 a.m., Ms. Cheng packed up and drove her husband from his home in Xu Dong to the hospital.
Not long after the car left the house, the baby couldn't wait to be born in his father's car.
After 20 minutes, Ms. Cheng and the baby finally arrived at the maternity and obstetrics building of the Hubei Provincial Maternal and Child Health Center.

When hospital security saw the distraught couple and their baby, they immediately notified the maternity ward, and Liu Yanyan, deputy chief physician and midwife, rushed downstairs with her baby bag and umbilical cord.
"At the time, the woman was half lying on the side of the car with amniotic fluid and blood under her and a baby boy next to her with the umbilical cord attached.

Zhang Huan inquired to learn that the baby is a 32-week premature baby, the road parents did not have time to cover the child's package, early autumn morning has been cool, he was frozen pale skin, no crying, limbs paralyzed.

Liu Yanyan hurried to the deputy to handle the umbilical cord for the baby, Zhang Huan got into the cab, quickly opened the delivery bag, wrapped the child with the inside of the treatment towel and the delivery bag cloth several layers of warmth, and cleaned the newborn's respiratory tract (pictured), then carried the baby up to the 12th floor neonatal unit.
Neonatal medical care heard the news, immediately rushed to the nurse station to rescue the premature baby on the spot.

At that time, the baby was purple, asphyxiation and lack of oxygen, doctors immediately gave him a trachea intubation, less than a minute, the baby's heartbeat, skin color gradually returned to rosy, successful resuscitation.
After being admitted to hospital, the 32-week-old baby was put on an invasive ventilator.
After a week of treatment, the baby's vital signs are stable, breathing is smooth, and a small amount of feeding has begun.

As it happens, on the 19th, 20th and 21st, the Obstetrics and Neonatology Department of the hospital received three premature babies on the road on three consecutive days, while the other two were born in 120 ambulances, both at 29 weeks, and are now under active care in the neonatology unit.

Sun Guoqiang, director of obstetrics at the provincial maternal and child health care center, said that in recent years, many babies born on the subway and in private cars have been received by mothers and children in the province.
Sun warned, pregnant mother once appear abdominal pain, broken water, see red phenomenon, should come to the hospital immediately.

If in the home or on the road, the mother should try to lie flat, can put a blanket under the buttock, etc., to prevent the baby after delivery head hit the ground, the child should be warm immediately after delivery, as soon as possible to the nearest doctor.
Yue Xin Aviation Technology Company officially opened

The establishment of VSTEA was one of the details of the memorandum of cooperation signed between VAECO and ST Engineering Aerospace in April 2018, marking the first joint venture for the maintenance and repair of aircraft equipment in Vietnam.
Two leading aviation technology companies, Vietnam and Singapore, cooperate to provide aircraft equipment maintenance and repair services to domestic and foreign airlines.
The company's joint venture partner, ST Engineering Aerospace, is the world's largest and highest-level aircraft maintenance group, said Yang Zhicheng, general manager of the company.
Vietnam Airlines believes this cooperation will bring benefits to both sides and is the beginning of a promising future partnership between the two sides.

Lim Serh Ghee, president of ST Engineering Aerospace, said that the sharing of experience between Vietnam Airlines and ST Engineering would help the consortium to provide international maintenance and repair services and contribute to the safety of airlines.
The birth of VSTEA helped Vietnam Airlines move in a deep and broad direction to join the potential to tap the huge aircraft equipment maintenance and repair market.
At the same time, there is a great opportunity to gain access to modern technology and to train senior aviation technicians.
This will better meet the sustainable development needs of Vietnam's aviation industry.
Research shows that manufacturing industry has become the focus of major countries' attention. - Xinhua News Agency

Hefei, September 27 (Xinhua) -- A white paper on the Global Manufacturing Innovation Index (GMI) was released in Hefei, Anhui Province, by the National Public Service Platform for Intellectual Property Rights (PIPR).
The white paper shows that manufacturing has become a major global concern.
This is the reporter at Hefei held "2019 World Manufacturing Congress Intellectual Property Operation and Protection Forum".

The Forum focused on IPR as an enabler of manufacturing upgrading in China, exploring innovative measures for IPR operation and protection in the manufacturing sector from the macro level of policy interpretation and the micro perspective of enterprise practice.

The forum invited scholars from the State Intellectual Property Office and the Chinese Academy of Sciences, as well as experts from relevant domestic and foreign trade organizations and professional research institutes, to share experiences and make suggestions on how to strengthen intellectual property protection and promote the use of intellectual property.

At the forum, the Anhui Provincial Bureau of Market Supervision released the report "Analysis and Evaluation of the Quality of Innovation Development in Anhui Province", which ranked Anhui Province eighth out of 31 provinces and municipalities in the country in the 2018 Patent Navigation Regional Innovation Quality Development Index, and fourth in the country in the Innovation Element Concentration Index.

The forum was hosted by the Anhui Provincial People's Government and jointly hosted by the Anhui Provincial Market Supervision Administration, the National Intellectual Property Operation Public Service Platform and the China Intellectual Property Development Alliance.

Wuhan Promotes Intelligent Transformation of Industrial Enterprises

Correspondent 27 from the Wuhan city government press office held a series of "salute the new China to welcome the military games" city conference, this year, the city has accelerated the industrial intelligence transformation, and implemented a maximum of 20 million yuan in transformation subsidies.
Up to now, more than 800 industrial enterprises have collected information on the demand for intelligent transformation.

Zhang Hong, deputy director of Wuhan's Bureau of Economic and Information Technology Affairs, said Wuhan had launched a plan of action for the intelligent transformation of industrial enterprises this year to provide free consultation and diagnostic services to industrial enterprises above the required scale and put forward solutions to promote a new round of high-level enterprise technological transformation.

According to the plan, each year Wuhan publicly selects a number of specialized diagnostic service institutions, through the opening of columns, questionnaires, door-to-door reporting, etc. for all industrial enterprises of all sizes above the city to carry out intelligent transformation needs survey.
To date, more than 800 regulatory industrial enterprises have been collected, accounting for nearly one third of the city's industrial enterprises.
Five municipal diagnostic platforms have organized teams to enter enterprises in batches to carry out "one-to-one" on-site evaluation and programme validation.

At present, the city is organizing and implementing 373 intelligent transformation projects, with a total investment of 29.76 billion yuan, the first 5G intelligent production line in Hongxin Communications, the leading intelligent mobile phone production line in China, the first batch satellite production line in China, the leading intelligent workshop and intelligent factory in Wuhan Siemens Transformer Digital Unmanned Factory, the first batch satellite production line in China, the leading new intelligent production line for veterinary drugs in Huisheng Biology World, and the intelligent production line for smart home products in Europe.
In addition, Wuhan has increased its financial support for intelligent transformation projects.
These include investment in equipment and hardware, soft investment in research and development, and a transition subsidy of 8%, up to 20 million yuan.

At the same time, financial institutions such as the joint venture bank and the Wuhan branch of the Zhejiang Commercial Bank have been actively engaged in providing personalized financial services for the intelligent transformation of industrial enterprises.
Trudeau ’ s “collapse, ” and can he be re-elected
It was Trudeau himself who stumbled out of the hole.
In recent days, the Canadian media has been bombarded with old photos of Prime Minister Trudeau posing as a black man.
This was seen as a clear act of racial discrimination that immediately caused a stir in Canada.
After it happened, Trudeau repeatedly apologized to the public.
Canadians, however, are not buying much.
Trudeau was able to lift a stone to his feet.

As political commentator Riley and others have pointed out, since the rise of the "anti-blackface movement" from the United States, Trudeau and the federal Liberal Party have been vocal in accusing the opposition or dissidents within their own party of being "at fault" in this regard, and have repeatedly threatened that "whoever makes this mistake should be summarily expelled".
In a nutshell, it was Trudeau himself who pulled out the "big hole" by stumbling across it.
Trudeau is the son of former Canadian Prime Minister Pierre Trudeau, a handsome young man who had a whirlwind of "political icons" when he made his debut.

After taking over as head of the federal Liberal Party, he fought an unexpectedly good fight in the 2015 federal legislative election, in which the federal Liberal Party won more than half of the seats in the federal lower house and gained valuable individual cabinet seats.

At the time, Trudeau proposed a number of bold political platforms and ideas, such as “ethnic and gender equality, ”“ eco-environmental protection, ” “economic revitalization, ” and an emphasis on ending corruption and“ injustice. ”
Yet, in his five years in power, he has “gone high and low ” on almost all of these fronts.

Take the issue of “ethnicity and gender equality, ” aside from the“ blackface, ” after his “lip service ” on a series of aboriginal issues led aboriginal groups and leaders to move protest tents to Capitol Hill on the 150th anniversary of Canada ’ s founding.
In the fight against corruption, at the end of last year and early this year, Trudeau was embroiled in a "Random House affair".
It was revealed that the construction company "Lan Wan Ling" in his hometown of major irregularities favoritism, to the investigation of the department and officials pressure the latter "high hand."
Moreover, Trudeau turned his back on the officials who disclosed the fraud – Wang Zhoudi, who was the first Canadian attorney general to do so.
Although the case itself is questionable, the suspicion is difficult to wash away.

Many observers have pointed out that the collapse of Trudeau ’ s five years in power was largely the result of his own “pit ”, the largest of which was the“ pit ” of “self-harming ” and“ forgiving and strict with the law. ”

According to Canada ’ s most authoritative Anguss-Reed poll, since 2015, support for Trudeau has slipped from more than 60% to more than 30%, while opposition has soared from less than 30% to more than 60%.

While other opposition parties and their party leaders have fared equally poorly, even a significant portion of voters who still want to vote for the federal Liberal Party are now disapproving of the federal prime minister, the head of the ruling party.
With Canada ’ s new federal legislative election set to begin on October 21, can Trudeau repeat the drama of his triumph five years ago?
The answer may be just one word: Difficult.

Whether from the level of enterprise competition, consumer experience, regional aviation integration, Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei development integration, have far-reaching impact and positive significance.
On September 25, Beijing Daxing International Airport officially opened.

Beijing News reporter from the Beijing Development and Reform Commission, the capital airport has been in a state of oversaturation, the opening of Daxing International Airport, will enhance the capital's air service capacity.

After Shanghai, Beijing becomes the second city in China to have two airports, with Shanghai Hongqiao International Airport serving mainly domestic aviation and Pudong Airport serving mainly international shipping.
Daxing Airport, from the perspective of business development, for the capital airport is more positive impact.

In 2018, the airport handled over 100 million passengers, the highest passenger throughput in the country, but still has a significant capacity gap compared to the rapidly growing business demand, especially for international routes.

In order to better serve domestic and international passenger travel and business travel needs, and in line with Beijing's increasingly open and internationally connected urban development trends, Daxing International Airport is positioned as a large international hub airport with a planned annual passenger throughput of 100 million passengers and cargo throughput of 4 million tons.
Therefore, the two airports do not overlap, targeting different customer groups, but also have sufficient market space.

From the economic point of view, the opening of Daxing International Airport will obviously have a win-win effect, easing the strain on Beijing's air capacity, accelerating the growth of passenger and cargo throughput, and creating an incremental cake for Capital Airlines' dual-core operation.

From the point of view of users, with the opening of Daxing International Airport, it is not necessary to focus on the capital airport in the future, but can also reduce the number of problems caused by the excessive concentration of routes, such as longer security time, slower passenger boarding, indirect increase of aircraft and passengers' time in the airport, increase the burden of airport operations, through the capital airport traffic reduction, but also improve the passenger travel experience.

According to the media estimates of the time and cost of various transport routes to large international airports, for example, from Nanwuhuan to Beijing to go directly to Daxing Airport high-speed, 50 minutes to drive, oil money back and forth 40 yuan, high-speed fare 15 yuan; but the choice of rail transit subway Daxing Airport Line, depending on the distance of 20 km, 30 km, fares are divided into 10 yuan, 25 yuan, 35 yuan 3; citizens can also take the Beijing-Xiong intercity, from Beijing West Station to Daxing Airport Station in just over 20 minutes.
In general, there are a wide range of transportation options available to the public, and the cost and time are within reasonable limits.

From the point of view of trend development: Daxing Airport is located in the Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei transportation hub, so the distance from the Beijing urban area, but enhanced radiation to Hebei, Tianjin, facilitate more people to travel, Hebei, Tianjin economic development is significant.
In the future, passengers in Hebei and Tianjin can enjoy more international air services provided by Daxing International Airport, as can be seen from the traffic planning of Daxing Airport.
In addition to the new airport line from downtown Beijing to Daxing Airport, there are several expressways connecting Daxing Airport with the surrounding area.

Just as passengers from Dongguan, Foshan, Qingyuan and other cities in Guangdong can travel to Guangzhou Baiyun Airport via expressways such as Guangzhou Buddha and Guangshen, residents of Beijing's surrounding Langfang and Xiong'an New Area will also benefit from Daxing Airport, which offers convenient and efficient air services.

From this, we can see that Daxing International Airport has not only added a few runways and a few aircraft, but also has far-reaching influence and positive significance from the level of enterprise competition, consumer experience, regional aviation integration and Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei development integration.
Therefore, for the Daxing airport, we not only need to account for the economy, but also for the overall development of the big account.

2019 Vietnam Economic and Social Forum held in Thanh Tiên Hóa Province

At the beginning of this year, Vietnam's economic and social development showed many new signs of improvement and continued to grow, said Nguyen Duc Jian, deputy director of the National Assembly's economic committee.
The forum focused on the economic and social issues highlighted in the first months of 2019 and proposed measures for economic and social development in late 2019 and 2020.

At the Forum, participants exchanged in-depth views on four themes, namely, economic development in 2019 and the impact of some FTAs, some salient issues in the Vietnamese economy in 2019, salient issues in Vietnamese society and culture in 2019, and projections and recommendations for economic and social development in Viet Nam in 2020.
There was general agreement that the first months of 2019 had seen a slowdown in global economic growth and increased risks and challenges.
Trade frictions between major economies have further shrunk global trade and investment.

The International Monetary Fund has determined that, despite the uncertainties in the global economy, in which 70% of the world ’ s economies have stagnated, Vietnam ’ s economic development has achieved many good results, with stable macroeconomic performance and effective control of inflation, with the consumer price index increasing by an average of 2.64% in the first half of 2019, the lowest rate in nearly three years.
GDP grew by 6.76% in the first half of 2019, down from 7.05% in the same period a year earlier, but still higher than the same period in 2011-2017.

In a forecast of the economic development trend of Vietnam in 2019-2020, Deng Deying, deputy director of the National Economic and Social Forecasting Center of Vietnam, said that in the context of the turbulence of the world economy, the Vietnamese economy in 2019 showed a high growth momentum.

It is expected that by 2020, Viet Nam's macro-economy will remain basically stable, the implementation of various FTAs will promote the development of trade, economic restructuring and the improvement of the business environment will be further strengthened, and Viet Nam's export activities will show a downward trend due to trade frictions.

Therefore, it is necessary to strengthen the monitoring and early warning mechanism, proactively seek trade relief measures for Vietnamese export commodities, seek opportunities to expand new export markets, and facilitate the export of various commodities such as agricultural and aquatic products.

At the same time, inflation should be kept at a reasonable level so as to promote the development of complementary industries and support the development of high-tech, organic and ecological agriculture.

Be careful with plastic tea bags!

A recent Canadian study found that a bag of plastic tea bags could release billions, if not billions, of plastic particles, significantly higher than a person's estimated annual intake of microplastics, but there is no evidence that ingestion poses a threat to humans.

Researchers at McGill University in Canada reported that immersing a plastic tea bag in a cup of almost boiling hot water (95 degrees Celsius) releases about 11.6 billion plastic particles and 3.1 billion smaller nanoparticles into the cup.
This amount is significantly higher than a person's estimated annual intake of microplastics.
According to research published earlier in 2019, the average person eats at least 50,000 plastic particles a year while inhaling the same amount of microplastics.

For the study, published in the Journal of Environmental Science and Technology, researchers tested four different types of plastic commercial tea bags in Montreal shops and cafes, opened them, cleaned them and dipped them in almost boiling water for five minutes before analyzing them with an electron microscope and spectrometer.
According to the study, they found that a single tea bag emitted more than 11.6 billion plastic particles, "several orders of magnitude higher than the plastic load of other foods".
Most tea bags are made of natural fibers, but many tea bag brands still use plastic to seal their mouths, the report said.
Some brands have switched from paper to plastic tea bags, which the researchers tested.
The plastic particles are tiny pieces of plastic, which the researchers define as being between 100 nanometers and 5 millimeters in size, produced mainly by the decomposition of plastic waste.
Researchers found traces of plastic particles in air, soil, rivers and deepest trenches around the world, as well as in tap water, bottled water, seafood and beer.
In October 2018, researchers found plastic particles in human waste samples from several countries in different regions of the world.

To test the potential toxicity of plastic particles released from tea bags, the Canadian research team put water fleas into contaminated water and found that microplastics affected their behavior and caused them to develop deformities.
According to the World Health Organisation (WHO), there is no evidence to date that ingestion of plastic particles poses a threat to humans.
However, the WHO noted that more research is needed to fully understand how these plastics spread into the environment and what impact they have on humans.

The researchers speculate that the bags emit large amounts of plastic particles, possibly because the bags come into contact with boiling water and may break down or ooze toxic substances even when heated to more than 40 degrees Celsius.
Mr Guterres said the climate emergency was the biggest threat to the survival of small island states.
There, a natural disaster can erode a generation's development gains.
This is illustrated by the hurricanes that have struck Barbuda, Dominica and the Bahamas this year.
About a quarter of people in small island developing States live at altitudes of 5 metres or less.
Relocation could seriously affect their societies and lifestyles and even raise questions of sovereignty and national identity.

Small island states are once again leading the world in the right direction as they work together to achieve carbon neutrality and 100% renewable energy by 2030 at a summit on climate action on Monday.
"The climate crisis is piling new injustices on top of old ones," Guterres said.
Although small island developing States contribute little to global warming, they pay the highest price.
Because of their middle-income status, many countries are also caught in an accelerating and unsustainable cycle of disasters and debt.
The world must act, and now is the time to take big decisions and invest heavily in small island developing States, "he said.

Today's high-level meeting adopted a political declaration calling for the search for ways to help small island developing States manage disaster risks, invest in climate-resilient infrastructure and transition to renewable energy; and urged international institutions to help small island developing States, particularly heavily indebted middle-income countries, access finance.
Small island developing States are at the forefront of protecting and conserving the Earth ’ s lifeline, the oceans.
The latest special report of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change, released this week, confirms that the oceans have already suffered the "sweeping" consequences of the climate crisis.
By the middle of the century, many regions may experience extreme sea level rise every year that would have occurred only once in a century.
The report warns that some island nations are likely to become uninhabitable without significant investment in adaptation.
Pollution, overfishing and acidification have taken a huge toll.
The world has lost half of all living corals in the past 150 years, while plastic pollution has increased tenfold in the past 40 years.
Demand from industry, shipping, mining and tourism is leading to reduced resources, including the maintenance of fishing grounds in many island communities.
Small island States also face high transport, energy and infrastructure costs.
They are heavily dependent on some external markets, making them subject to price fluctuations.
Some States are also grappling with the security implications of illicit trafficking in persons, arms and drugs.
"By solving a problem in the most challenging circumstances, the problem can be solved anywhere," Guterres said.
The efforts of small island developing States to achieve the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development will provide us with tools, lessons learned and examples for the world to learn from. "
He stressed that small island developing States were a special case for sustainable development.
They require the long-term attention and investment of the entire international community.

Russia will not export the system for the next five years, he said, because "it will first supply its own military and then export production".

Guided by Xi ’ s diplomatic thinking, China is participating in international affairs in a more active and productive manner, making greater contributions to world peace and development and assuming more responsibilities.
China has always been a builder of world peace, a contributor to global development and a defender of international order.
The document introduces China's important contributions to the three pillars of the UN: peace, development and human rights.

To reaffirm China's firm support for and practice of multilateralism and the central role of the United Nations in international affairs; to point out that China's development resonates with that of the world and that the two are mutually reinforcing; and to stress that in the face of the unprecedented changes in the world, a developing China will contribute more and more positive energy to the world.

The "UN Climate Action Summit: China's Position and Actions" closely follows the nine action areas of the UN Climate Action Summit, and introduces China's policies and propositions on international cooperation on climate change and China's achievements in addressing climate change.

As the largest developing country in the world, China regards addressing climate change as its inherent requirement for sustainable development and its responsibility for building a community of human destiny, and will continue to overcome many difficult challenges to its development, firmly uphold multilateralism, implement international commitments and make every effort to fully and effectively implement the Paris Agreement.

The Progress Report on China's Implementation of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development (2019) is the second progress report issued by China following the release of the implementation progress report in 2017.

The report provides a comprehensive overview of China's actions, progress, challenges and next steps in implementing the 2030 Agenda, and shows China's determination and achievements in implementing the new development concept and achieving high-quality development.

The report ’ s examples of precision poverty reduction, innovation-led development, eco-civilization building, rural revitalization, and “one belt, one road ” will serve as useful lessons for other countries in implementing the 2030 agenda.

The Report on Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) on Earth Big Data Support showcases China's exploration and practice of using Earth Big Data to support the implementation of the 2030 Agenda and policy decision-making, and reveals the application value and prospects of relevant technologies and methods for monitoring and assessing the SDGs, thus providing new perspectives and support for the international community to fill data and methodological gaps and accelerate the implementation of the 2030 Agenda.
