Lao collectives and individuals were awarded the National Medal and Emblem of Viet Nam

According to the decision of the President of Viet Nam, Nguyen Phu Trung, on 21 September, on the award of the Order of Independence, Viet Nam awarded the Order of Independence to 12 collectives and 13 individuals from the Lao National Assembly, the organs of the National Assembly, the Secretariat of the National Assembly, etc., in recognition of their positive contribution to the consolidation and strengthening of the special relations of solidarity between the National Assembly and the organs of the National Assembly of Viet Nam.
Vietnamese President Nguyen Phu Trung also issued a decision on the award of the Order of Friendship and the Order of Friendship.

Pursuant to that decision, the State of Viet Nam decided to award 21 friendship medals and 17 friendship badges to 4 collectives and 34 individuals of the Lao National Assembly, the organs of the National Assembly and the Secretariat of the National Assembly, in recognition of their active contribution to the consolidation and strengthening of the special relations of solidarity between the National Assembly and the organs of the National Assembly of the two countries.

In her speech at the ceremony, Ms. Nguyen stressed that the inextricable relationship between the older two peoples had been forged from a long historical process and that the good traditional friendship, consistency and selfless relationship between the Vietnamese and Lao peoples had been forged by the hands of President Ho Chi Minh and President Kishan Phong Wai Han and carefully cultivated by the two parties, the successive leaders and the people of the two countries.

Ms. Nguyen stressed that under the complex and changeable world situation, the old and great friendship, special friendship and all-round cooperation had been continuously consolidated and developed and were becoming deeper and more pragmatic.

Ms. Nguyen stressed that the award of medals and emblems of the Party and State of Viet Nam to the collective and former senior leaders of the Lao National Assembly was a recognition by the Party, the State and the people of Viet Nam of the great contributions made by all comrades, and expressed the hope that all comrades would continue their efforts and make more contributions to strengthening the great friendship, special solidarity and all-round cooperation of the Lao People's Democratic Republic.

Ms. Nguyen stressed that the Party and State of Viet Nam will continue to maintain close cooperation with the Lao Party and State, inherit and bring into play the achievements of cooperation between the two sides, and actively consolidate and promote the great friendship, special solidarity and all-round cooperation between the two countries.

The collective and individual members of the Lao National Assembly who have been awarded the Order of Independence, the Order of Friendship and the Insignia of Friendship have expressed their gratitude to the State of Viet Nam for the award of their honour, affirming that it is not only their honour but also that of the Lao National Assembly.
In the United States, e-cigarettes have been linked to 805 cases of lung damage in 12 lives.
U.S. health officials said 12 people have died from e-smoking-related illnesses and 805 cases of lung damage linked to e-cigarettes.
The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reported the figures and said it had not identified the specific substance that caused the disease.
However, most patients reported the use of e-cigarette products containing tetrahydrocannabinol, the main psychoactive compound in cannabis.
The spike in lung cases is known to be linked to the purchase of contaminated electronic smoke vaporizers on the black market.

According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the 12 deaths occurred in 10 states from California to Florida, and 805 confirmed and suspected cases were reported in 46 states and the U.S. Virgin Islands.
In the past three weeks, e-cigarette sales have been banned in India and Massachusetts, and flavored e-cigarettes have been banned in New York and Michigan.
The Trump administration intends to ban e-cigarette products with all flavors other than tobacco from Oct.
When will the next bus come?
"Internet + Smart Station" lets you know.
The first batch of "Internet + Smart Stations" will be installed in Nanjing, where 54 bus electronic screens will be lit up.
In the past, the anxious scenes of waiting for a bus were staged almost daily at bus stops.

It is difficult to predict the running time of buses, the condition of buses and the location of vehicles along the route. The problem of bus pain points needs to be solved urgently, especially in some big cities.

To this end, Nanjing Smart Transportation Co., along with Gaude map to explore the new direction of "Internet + Transportation" convenient services, launched the first nationwide "Internet + Smart Station" intelligent service project.

It is reported that the first batch of "Internet + Smart Stations" in China landed in Nanjing, fusing the data of Gao De Da and the ETA algorithm of Gao De's vehicle expected travel time, and relying on the bus electronic signs and mobile Internet, traffic big data upgrade, the realization of "bus smart signs + electronic map" double-end bus routes, bus expected arrival time, and so on.

Through the "Internet + Smart Station", Nanjing citizens can not only easily obtain the bus arrival time, know the bus real-time location and a few stops away from the current station, but also intuitively grasp the bus route through the three colors of red, orange and green, so that all bus routes through the station can be seen in real time.

As a result of the "Internet + Smart Station" technology, Nanjing citizens have realized the convenient and efficient way of public transportation, such as "checking the bus position before going out, grasping the station time when waiting for the bus, understanding the arrival time when taking the bus".

According to the "Internet + Smart Station" real-time bus information, choose the most suitable route for their own travel, while at the same time can do a good job of psychological expectations, reduce the anxiety of waiting for a car, thus making travel easier.
More than 30 artifacts from the Summer Palace on display for the first time - Xinhua News Agency
According to the Beijing Summer Palace Administration, more than 30 of the 99 pieces of cultural relics are on display for the first time in the Summer Palace.

It is reported that the exhibition is divided into four exhibition areas: Rui Yu Ji Jin, Fu Shu Shouquan, odd works of art, Fu Zhenghua, jade bronze, ancient calligraphy and painting, miscellaneous, porcelain enamel and other categories of cultural relics.

The Deputy Director of the Cultural Relics Department of the Summer Palace Administration, Li Jia, said that the number of high-level cultural relics, a variety of cultural relics, exhibits span a long time.
Nearly 30% of the exhibits are national-level cultural relics and Grade II cultural relics from the Shang Dynasty to the Qing Dynasty.
The Shang Dynasty is the oldest bronze relic in the exhibition, dating back more than 3000 years. It is the first of its kind to be exhibited to the public.

Qin Lei, deputy director of the Summer Palace Administration in Beijing, said that the cultural exhibition embraces the spirit of "living up" to cultural relics, relying on the Summer Palace's "Fukuyama Shouhai" garden idea, with the theme of "Fukuoshou" as the carrier, so that visitors can learn about the Summer Palace through the exhibition, promote and inherit Chinese traditional culture, and convey good wishes for a happy birthday.
The exhibition will run until January 30, 2020.

The boss of a Woolworths supermarket has been slammed as "disgraceful" after the Fair Work Commission found he sacked a 66-year-old female worker via text message because he preferred to hire staff from an Asian background.

The council said Ms Gail Ayton's boss, Jianbin Wang, who has worked at the Wagga Wagga store for more than 20 years, had treated staff in a "grossly unfair" manner and may have breached anti-discrimination laws.
Ms Ayton told the committee that Mr Wang, who took over the shop in 2016, had been "trying to fire me" because she was not Chinese.

In the case, the commission's deputy chairman Peter Sams conducted an internet search and found "a number of job advertisements that Mr Wang had posted in the past on various Chinese-Australian employment forums."
Among the job requirements listed in the posts, one said "preferred Asian lady" and the other said "preferred Asian employee."
A third post said he was "more inclined to go overseas (sic)."
Mr Wang sacked Ms Ayton in April this year via text message, later claiming it was due to her absenteeism and the alleged absence of a small amount of cash from $5.10 to $30 at the cash register.
But Mr Sams said Mr Wang's reasons for dismissing Ms Ayton were weak and lacked evidence.
She has been absent from only one shift in three years, and the "missing amount" totals a few dollars.
He said Ms Ayton's dismissal was "not actually related to her conduct or performance."

"It seems to me that the real motivation for the respondent to dismiss her, supported by the evidence of the job advertisement released by Mr Wang, was that he preferred to hire staff with an Asian background," he said.
Under section 772 (f) of the Fair Work Act, Mr Wang's conduct ostensibly constitutes a breach of anti-discrimination law and / or dismissal of the applicant is unlawful, "the statement said.
Mr Sams said it was inappropriate for him to consider reinstating Ms Ayton, given the "appalling" treatment of her by Mr Wang.
He should consider paying compensation to Ms Ayton, who is a casual worker with an hourly salary of A $26.

In light of possible breaches of anti-discrimination and industrial relations legislation, Mr Sams said he would refer his own findings and documents to council chiefs to consider whether Mr Wang's conduct should be referred to other agencies to investigate possible breaches of state or federal law.
He said Mr Wang had not given Ms Ayton any opportunity to respond to the alleged reasons for her dismissal.

"I believe the respondent engaged in an irredeemably unfair and biased process to dismiss the applicant and Mr Wang" waited "for this opportunity, which he believed would 'justify' the termination of the applicant's employment," he said.
"He was wrong... the respondent completely disregarded any natural justice in dismissing the applicant and, alarmingly, was disrespectful and grossly unfair in his perfunctory behaviour."

Mr Sams said that while Foodworks was a small business, "it has to be said frankly that no decent employer would dismiss an employee in the extremely unfair and perfunctory way that was acknowledged in this case."
"It's disgraceful and it's extremely unfair," he said.

6 persons denied involvement in the sale of fake Marca paper to the High Court

Six men, including an assistant director of the National Registration Office and a businessman of the rank of Datuk, who are suspected of forging and selling our passports, papers and identity cards, appeared in court on Thursday and were transferred to the High Court on charges of anti-trafficking in persons and anti-trafficking in migrants.

One of the original lawyers representing the Chinese-American defendant, Lai Zhenhua, also a member of the Sunset Cave District Council, applied to the judge to withdraw from representing the defendant in the case.
He stated that he had attracted criticism from political opponents for representing the accused and that his party was implicated.

He stressed that he was not afraid of any threat, but did not want to be used by irresponsible units to smear the DAP and the Government of the League or other leaders of the League, and therefore made the decision after careful consideration.
He also said that there was no conflict of interest between representing the defendant and being a member of Parliament, and that he was not legally barred from representing any of the defendants.

On 12 September this year, the six defendants appeared in court and pleaded not guilty to various charges under section 26E of the Anti-Trafficking in Persons and Anti-Trafficking in Migrants Ordinance and section 466 of the Criminal Code (forgery of documents).

On Thursday, two district court judges, Noshaha and Mazlan, granted the prosecution's application to transfer the charges against the six defendants in relation to the anti-trafficking in persons and anti-trafficking in migrants order to the High Court, after the prosecution's arguments, while the charges of forgery of documents will be heard in court on 3 October, pending the transfer of documents by the prosecution to the defence.
The previous six defendants had been arrested under the National Security Offences (Special Measures) Act 2012 (SOSMA) and the judge had therefore not granted bail.

The main shaft of the deepest railway shaft in China is dug to the end.

Kunming, Sept. 27 (Xinhua) -- According to China Railway Tunnel Bureau Group Co., Ltd., the first long tunnel of China Railways - Dai (Li) Rui (Li) Railway Gaoligongshan Tunnel No. 1 shaft main well was successfully dug on the 27th, the depth of 762.59 meters broke the record for the deepest domestic railway shaft.
In tunnel construction, shaft can improve tunnel ventilation, improve ballast efficiency and ensure construction safety.

"The successful completion of the first shaft of the Gaoligongshan Tunnel will help push forward the construction of the underground vehicle yard, opening many working faces for the later construction of the sinkhole and horizontal guide, and speeding up the construction of the entire Gaoligongshan Tunnel," said Song Tao, chief engineer of the shaft area of the Dali Project Department of the China Railway Tunnel Bureau.

According to Song Tao, the construction of No. 1 shaft of Gaoligongshan Tunnel was carried out by means of a well drilling method, equipped with large specialized machines such as a chisel frame, a chisel stabilizer, a chisel winch, an integral moving metal template, a FJD-6A type umbrella drill, a central rotary rock grab machine, and so on.
It is understood that the Dali to the east and Ruili to the west, about 331 km long, designed to speed 140 km / h, is an important part of the China-Myanmar international railway corridor.
With a total length of 34.538 km, the Gaoligongshan Tunnel is the first long tunnel in China.

China is on track to become Australia's biggest beef export market.

China is facing a severe pork shortage following an outbreak of African swine fever and is on track to become Australia's biggest beef export market, according to an animal protein analyst at Rabobank.

Chinese consumers are switching from eating pork to other animal proteins in the wake of the outbreak, which has led authorities to destroy many herds, halving the number of live pigs in China and nearly doubling pork prices in the past year.
China produces and consumes two-thirds of the world's pork.

Chenjun Pan, senior animal protein analyst for the Dutch cooperative bank China, said demand for other meats, including beef, had increased, with China, the world's largest animal protein importer, now accounting for 27 per cent of pork imports and 24 per cent of beef imports.
Ms. Pan said that in the first half of this year, Chinese beef imports from Australia increased by 65%, with China overtaking the United States and Japan as Australia's largest beef export market.
Yesterday, the government said it would release more pork from emergency reserves before celebrating the 70th anniversary of the ruling Communist Party of China.
White Paper: China has always placed its own development in the human development coordinate system

The white paper says that China has always placed its own development in the frame of reference for human development and has always closely linked its own destiny with that of people all over the world.
The white paper says China promotes world peace and development through its own development.

As the largest developing country in the world, China will unswervingly follow its own path and concentrate its efforts on its own affairs so as to make its country more prosperous and its people more happy and to inject stability and certainty into a complex and changing world, which in itself is the greatest contribution to world peace and development.
Under the guidance of Xi Jinping's ideology of socialism with Chinese characteristics in the new era, China will continue to unswervingly follow the path of socialism with Chinese characteristics.

China always takes economic development as the central task in rejuvenating the country, unswervingly takes the road of high-quality development, implements the new development concepts of innovation, coordination, green, openness and sharing, and accelerates the building of a modern economic system to better meet the people's growing needs for a better life.
Let the common people live a good life, is always the biggest goal of China's development.
The Chinese army has always been a staunch defender of world peace.
The white paper says China is committed to win-win cooperation and common development.
"The Chinese people want to live a good life not only for themselves, but also for the people of other countries.

China adheres to the principle of development innovation, growth linkage and convergence of interests, promotes the joint construction of the "One Belt, One Road" and high-quality development, and promotes global poverty reduction and development.
The white paper says China is determined to safeguard and promote economic globalization.
China is an active participant and staunch supporter of economic globalization.
China is ready to work with the rest of the international community to strengthen guidance and make the process of economic globalization more dynamic, inclusive and sustainable.

China will implement a more proactive strategy of opening up, create a more comprehensive, deeper and diversified pattern of opening up, achieve wider mutual benefit and win-win results, and take concrete actions to safeguard and promote economic globalization.

China is firmly opposed to unilateralism and protectionism, and will open more and more doors to the outside world, accelerate regional economic integration and continue to promote the internationalization of the renminbi.
"China firmly supports multilateralism and upholds international equity and justice," the white paper said.

China will, as always, firmly safeguard the international system with the United Nations at its core and the international order with the purposes and principles of the Charter of the United Nations at its core.
Safeguarding fairness and justice is China's basic principle in handling international issues.

China respects the development path and social system independently chosen by the people of all countries, respects the sovereignty and territorial integrity of all countries, and opposes interference by outside forces in the internal affairs of other countries.
China will never impose its will on others, nor will it allow anyone to impose their will on the Chinese people.
The white paper says China is actively involved in leading the reform and construction of the global governance system.

As a responsible power, China has always maintained a balance between its rights and obligations, and has not only seen China's development meet the demands of the world, but also the expectations of the international community, and actively participated in the reform and construction of the global governance system.

China actively supports the UN in carrying out reform, and urges the UN to better adapt itself to the new requirements of global governance in terms of ideology, organization and mode of operation, better fulfill the responsibilities entrusted to it by the UN Charter, and play a greater role in safeguarding world peace and promoting common development.

China is actively promoting the innovative development of the concept of global governance, summarizing the successful practices and experiences of national governance in a timely manner, actively exploring the positive ways of dealing with the world in Chinese culture, the concept of governance and the common points of our times, and striving to contribute to the improvement of global governance with Chinese wisdom, Chinese plans and Chinese strength.

World's oldest hairdresser dies at age 108 after 96 years of haircuts
Anthony Mancinelli, 108, the world's oldest hairdresser with a Guinness World Record in New York, never retired to cut his guests' hair daily, but died of complications from jaw cancer on the 19th.

According to CNN, Mancinelli emigrated to the United States when he was 8 years old, helped clean floors at a barbershop soon after, and began taking scissors to serve guests at age 12 to ease the financial strain on his family.
Mancinelli attended elementary school but did not graduate.
Mancinelli's son, Robert, revealed that his father loved to work and people from all over the world loved him, but he was diagnosed with cancer in February, six weeks before his death.
Robert, 82, said he now has to find a new hairdresser after his father's death, as he has had to ask his father for a haircut all his life.
Repurchase of more than $100 billion of listed companies reached a record high during the year.

In order to stabilize the company's share price and maintain its image, listed companies have started to buy back shares frequently in the past two years, hoping to send the message that the company is undervalued to the market by means of targeted buybacks and pooled bidding transactions, thus stabilizing the stock price and boosting investor confidence.

According to Oriental Wealth Choice, the amount of capital used by listed companies to buy back shares in 2017 was 7.9 billion yuan, which jumped to 5.1 billion yuan in 2018, and since 2019, the total amount of capital repurchased by A-share listed companies has exceeded 100 billion yuan.

From the point of view of the purpose of repurchase, the company repurchase shares and the majority shareholder increase appear to be the same, but in the implementation of the subject, the source of funds, the use of repurchase, the equity of the stock itself, and so on.

In an interview with the Securities Daily, Xu Yang, chairman of the Shanghai Mykolong Information Consulting Co. Ltd., said that the "Opinions on Supporting the Repurchase of Shares by Listed Companies", which was introduced in November 2018, had remedied problems with the existing system, such as the narrow scope of share repurchase, complicated decision-making procedures and inadequate inventory system.

In January this year, the Shanghai and Shenzhen stock exchanges formally promulgated the "Rules for the Implementation of the Repurchase of Shares by Listed Companies," which broaden the sources of funds for the repurchase of listed companies, properly simplify the implementation procedures, guide the improvement of governance arrangements, and encourage various listed companies to implement stock incentive or employee stock ownership plans.

After the opinion is issued, the listed company carries on the operation of the share repurchase, has more applicable situation, the repurchase process is more simple, the share repurchase enthusiasm is also greater.

Buying back shares at a relatively low position also helps listed companies to increase the efficiency of their use of capital, thereby increasing the level of earnings per share, raising the return on net assets and easing the pressure on corporate earnings metrics.
Compared with the majority shareholder, the buyback of shares of listed companies is more significant, also reflects the active market value of listed companies management will and cash flow.
According to Xu, the undervaluation of stock prices is a major factor in the buyback of listed companies, and the company's stock prices do not reflect the future of the company.
Listed companies with large-scale buybacks at least demonstrate the company's development confidence and financial strength.

The growing enthusiasm for buybacks among A-share listed companies has also normalized buybacks, with data showing that nearly a thousand listed companies have implemented share buybacks this year, and leading companies in various industries have become the mainstay of the buyback market.

China Ping An recently disclosed the progress of the buyback, saying that the company had repurchased 57.59 million shares of A shares, or 0.315% of the company's total share capital, through a centralized bidding process, with the total amount of funds paid totaling 5 billion yuan (excluding transaction fees).

Erie shares have paid $5.792 billion for share buybacks, and recently adjusted the use of the repurchased shares from the original plan "to use all of the repurchased shares as a source of equity incentives for later implementation" to "cumulative repurchase of 183 million shares, of which 152 million shares will be used as a source of equity incentives and the remaining 30.49 million shares will be written off to reduce registered capital."

Yili shares said that some of the repurchased shares will be written off, in order to further enhance the level of earnings per share, effectively enhance the company's shareholders return on investment.
TCL Group announced on September 25 that it would buy back 3.59% of the company's shares at a total cost of 1.65 billion yuan.
The repurchase of shares will be used for employee stock ownership plans, equity incentives or convertible corporate bonds issued by listed companies, the TCL board office told the Securities Daily.
TCL adheres to its established business strategy, continuously improves its competitiveness and continues to develop healthily.

Based on the confidence in the future development of the company and the protection of investors' interests, combined with the performance of the secondary market of the company's shares over the past year, and taking into account the operating and financial conditions of the company, the company plans to use its own capital, self-financing and other financing methods to buy back the company's shares.

Yang Delong, the former chief economist of the Shanghai Open Source Fund, said the buyback of shares by listed companies, on the one hand, would reduce the number of shares in circulation on the market and increase the earnings per share of listed companies, which is an important positive for secondary market share prices.

Buybacks of domestic listed companies have increased gradually in recent years, particularly in blue-chip stocks, and boosting investor confidence through share buybacks is a very good way to do so, and one that deserves recognition and encouragement.

Gansu Qingyang: Lake sheep pack to "get out of poverty."
The autumn of September brings the loess plateau.

A 58-year-old villager at the Yimin Cultivation Cooperative in the town of Stagecoach, Shaveli, fills the trough with the last shovelful of grass and stands by the trough, watching the white lake sheep munch.
"Good to eat, wait for autumn and winter full fat, the column can sell good price."
Chavelli said he feeds the sheep a "special nutritious meal" every day, regularly cleaning, sterilizing, meticulously waiting to be neglected.
He kept sheep for more than 20 years, until he came to work in a cooperative and learned how extensive sheep herding used to be.
Xia Wei is a resident of Qingcheng County, Qingyang City, Gansu Province.
His neighbors are sheep farmers, but adhere to the traditional way of scattering, poor quality sheep, small output.
In June this year, under the guidance of the government, 140 poor families in the village joined the cooperative and everything began to change.
All day long, Chavelli was immersed in the study of breeding, because his mind was always suffocating.
The owners of the shares were all poor families, and they all trusted the sheep to the cooperative.
Fortunately, with the guidance of technicians, he slowly learned to engage in epidemic prevention, mastered scientific feeding, has become a small number of village farming "good."
It is a standardised cooperative with 16 sheep sheds and nearly 1400 lake sheep.
Zou Tao, head of the cooperative, said that standardized sheep shed inside and outside, are very good.

"The wool is thick and easy to breed germs, the lake sheep cannot stay in the hot and humid place, the sheep shed must be built on three sides of the ditch, and a fan must be installed to ventilate the heat.
Zou Tao said that in order to prevent epidemics, it is also necessary to regularly spray and disinfect the sheep shed, giving the sheep three to four anti-epidemic injections a quarter.
In addition to living well, "Little Sheep" has to eat a mixture of silage corn, wheat grass, alfalfa, etc., and has a wide enough "playground" stretch.

Cooperatives have adopted the method of custody and substitute breeding, and have guided local farmers to raise, manage and sell improved species of lake sheep here in a unified way to achieve improved, scientific, standardized and intensive breeding.
Today, 140 poor households with sheep in their shares receive annual dividends of more than 6,000 yuan per household.

In Qingyang, Gansu Province, sheep farming is more than just a change of feeding pattern, the model of "leading enterprises + cooperatives + farmers" has changed the scene of "sheep raising on the hillside, selling sheep in the market", overcoming the weakness of traditional agriculture and animal husbandry, and the poor days of farmers have become better because of modern sheep farming.

If market prices are weak, local leader Gansu Zhongsheng Agricultural and Animal Husbandry Development Co., Ltd. will buy them at a market protection price of 27 yuan per kilogram to help farmers spread market risk, Zou said.

Xu Jianfeng, general adviser of Gansu Zhongsheng Agricultural and Animal Husbandry Development Co., Ltd., said that enterprises are encouraging more and more poor households to read the Sutra by providing such services as loan guarantee, sheep supply, order raising, quotation purchasing and unified processing and sales.

In Qingyang, at least 8,200 poor families have achieved steady income growth by "joining" the agricultural and animal husbandry of Zhongsheng in forage farming, fine seed breeding, scale breeding, slaughter division and marketing.
Qingyang City is located in the northern agricultural and pastoral interlaced zone, rich in forage resources.

At present, there are 913 large-scale meat sheep farms, cooperatives, more than 5 million meat sheep, and the construction of two 1.3 million meat sheep slaughter scale processing lines, sheep are becoming the industry poverty alleviation "leader."
French finance minister says more than 10 billion euros in tax cuts next year and calls on Germany to follow suit

PARIS (Reuters) - France will cut taxes by more than 10 billion euros ($10.9 billion) next year, and Germany should keep up with France's fiscal stimulus to revive a sluggish economy, French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said on Thursday.
Introducing France's 2020 budget, Le Maire said the ECB's latest monetary easing had created an opportunity for governments of member states that could afford it to increase investment.

The European Central Bank cut interest rates to record lows on September 12 and plans to restart debt purchases in an effort to drive down borrowing costs, hoping to stimulate economic recovery and push up inflation.
"Low interest rates will not return Europe to prosperity, and monetary policy measures are necessary but not sufficient," Le Maire told reporters.
"Germany needs to invest, now, sooner rather than later. Don't wait for things to get worse," he added.
He has made this appeal to Germany on several occasions.
France has already implemented more than €10 billion in tax cuts this year, giving a big boost to its economic growth.
And the global economy has lost momentum, with export-dependent Germany bearing the brunt.
Le Maire pointed out that the tax burden on French households will be reduced by €9.3 billion next year, including €5 billion in income tax relief.
In addition, the corporate tax burden will be reduced by nearly €1 billion over a five-year period as the company tax rate is phased in from 33.3% to 25%.

General Secretary Xi Jinping recently issued important instructions on the protection of martyrs' memorial facilities, stressing the need to strengthen the planning, construction, renovation, management and maintenance of the martyrs' cemetery.

In order to thoroughly implement the important guiding spirit of General Secretary Xi Jinping and focus on promoting the protection and management of martyr memorial facilities, the General Offices of the CPC Central Committee, the State Council and the General Office of the CMC have recently issued the General Work Program on the Planning, Repair and Maintenance of Martyrs Memorial Facilities.

The Work Program is a programmatic document for the protection and management of memorial facilities for martyrs, defining the objectives and tasks for the protection and management of memorial facilities for martyrs, and proposing to plan the construction of memorial facilities for martyrs and improve the system of red educational bases for the promotion of the spirit of the martyrs; to renovate and protect memorial facilities for martyrs and create a strong social atmosphere in which the martyrs are honoured and remembered for their achievements; and to manage and maintain memorial facilities for martyrs and form a standard and complete organizational security management system.

The Work Program clearly states that the repair and protection of martyrs' memorial facilities should be strengthened, and that the repair and protection of martyrs' memorial facilities should be earnestly strengthened in accordance with the principle of overall planning and taking a long-term perspective, with emphasis on improving the leadership system and the system of policies and regulations; organizing the implementation of quality improvement projects, improving facilities and equipment, and enhancing service capacity; and optimizing the presentation of content, making innovations in the manner of exhibition and enhancing overall effectiveness.

The Work Program emphasizes the need to improve the institutional system and organizational guarantee, strengthen organizational leadership, establish a working mechanism led by the Ministry of Veterans Affairs, with the active cooperation of relevant units and broad participation of the society; focus on the implementation of the Law on the Protection of Heroes and Martyrs, improve the legal and regulatory system, and continuously promote the institutionalization, standardization and professionalization of the management and maintenance of the planning and construction of Martyrs' Memorial Facilities; strengthen team building, introduce volunteer services, and encourage veterans, families of martyrs, experts, scholars and young students to actively participate in the interpretation of Martyrs' Memorial Facilities and the maintenance of order, etc.; improve the social participation mechanism, adhere to government leadership and diversified input, and actively advocate encouraging enterprises, social organizations and individuals to provide donations and support for the renovation and protection of Martyrs' Memorial Facilities.
Study: U.S. National Healthy Eating Index up slightly but still challenging - CNET
A new study shows a modest increase in the U.S. government's healthy eating index from 56 to 58 over the past 16 years.
But when the full score is 100, it's not something to celebrate.
Americans still face "significant challenges" in their diet.

One of the study's authors, Dr. Fangfang Zhang, a nutrition researcher at Tufts University in Massachusetts, said Americans still eat too much of the foods that are most likely to cause heart disease, diabetes and obesity, which are the most common diseases among Americans.
The study was published online April 24 in the Journal of the American Medical Association.
The study was based on findings from a U.S. government health survey of 4.4 million adults conducted between 1999 and 2016.
"Despite significant improvements, significant dietary challenges remain," the authors wrote.
The challenges are known to include getting U.S. nationals to cut down on foods that contain saturated fat, such as snacks, hot dogs, fat cows and butter.
The study found that people's daily intake of these unhealthy fats increased from 11.5% to 12%, exceeding the recommended limit of 10%.
The biggest improvement in the national diet has been a reduction in sugar intake from 16% to about 14%, but the intake is still too high.
Officially, the intake of added sugar in the diet should be less than 10%.

As for the reason for the decrease in sugar intake, the researchers believe it is related to a reduction in people's consumption of sweet sodas, but Zhang stressed that sugars are often added to even less sweet foods, such as yogurt and ketchup.
Adults in the United States have seen a small increase in their intake of fruits, nuts, oats, and other whole grains.
However, 2016 data show that these foods still account for less than 5% of the daily diet.

Despite a slight decrease in salt intake and a drop in fruit juice consumption that has led to lower quality carbohydrates, Zhang said they still account for up to 42% of daily calories, many of which come from refined white bread and other refined grains.
The study was based on biennial personal health surveys that asked adults to recall what they had eaten in the past 24 hours.
These health surveys have asked this question twice every few days since 2003.
The government's Dietary Guidelines for Americans recommend adopting a "healthy eating pattern" to reduce the risk of chronic disease.

The guidelines state that people should eat more nutrient-dense foods such as vegetables, fruits, whole grains, low-fat dairy products, as well as seafood, lean meats, poultry meat, eggs, and seed foods that provide protein.

During the study period, the number of Americans with diabetes nearly doubled, to more than 7%, and obesity rates increased over the intervening years – today, about 70% of American adults are overweight or obese.
In addition, heart disease remains the leading cause of death among U.S. nationals.

China's first shareholding banking subsidiary to set up technology-enabled management business
26, Guangda Bank wholly-owned subsidiary Guangda Financial Management Co. Ltd. was formally established in Qingdao, China's first joint-stock bank financial management subsidiary.

Dong Ximiao, a special researcher at the National Finance and Development Laboratory, said that under the new competitive situation facing the management industry, financial technology companies and management institutions will explore new growth paths with management technology.

At the beginning of this year, Jingdong Digital Science and Technology launched a new management technology system to enhance the R & D and wind control capabilities of management products through technology and digital means.
The new system from product design, sales transactions, asset management, risk assessment of the four major capabilities to improve the management of the overall intelligent operation level.
Experts believe that, while improving customer service capacity, innovation and rich products, management technology can also enhance the ability of risk prevention, improve management efficiency.

Mr Zhang said that while in the past it had been easy to skew the risks of customers through questionnaires, the use of artificial intelligence for user profiling had helped to better position customers, to launch products based on their investment preferences and to defuse risks.
"Electronic commerce, spatiotemporal data and other alternative big data can help us better characterize a region, an industry's activity, prosperity."
While defusing the risks, big data technology will also help improve wind control capabilities, Zhang said.
Chinese railway tunnel shaft's deepest record is refreshed

After more than 1,200 days of round-the-clock construction, the No. 1 shaft of the Gaoligongshan Tunnel was completed on the 27th, reaching a depth of 762.59 meters below the surface, breaking the record for the deepest shaft of a railway tunnel in China, which was set in a flood of water.

The 34.5 km Dali Railway Gaoligong Mountain Tunnel, located in Yunnan Province, runs from the west bank of the Nujiang River through the Gaoligong Mountains, making it the longest single tunnel in Asia.

The tunnel runs through 19 fault zones, with a maximum depth of 1,155 metres, and is known as the "Geological Museum" of Tunnel Construction because it covers almost all of the adverse geology and significant risks associated with tunnel construction.

The shaft is the most important auxiliary tunnel of the Gaoligongshan Tunnel, with the important task of increasing the operating surface to achieve the "short tunnel" and the ventilation of the later railway operation.

The successful excavation of the No. 1 shaft to the bottom of the well marked the formal entry of the Gaoligongshan Tunnel into the horizontal tunnel construction, and after the excavation of the bottom of the well yard and the replacement of equipment, the underground can be increased by four operating surfaces to speed up the excavation of the tunnel.

"The shaft is all in the granite formation, because there are more fractures in the granite formation, which cannot stop the water, flowing from top to bottom, basically as deep as the water pressure in the well."

The Chief Engineer of the Dali Rui Railway Project Department of the China Railway Tunnel Bureau, Shi Jingzhao, told reporters that the shaft construction, many times occurred muddy water inrush, collapse and other dangers, the construction side invited experts on the spot, more than 20 times to discuss the treatment plan.

"The maximum inrush of water in the shaft is more than 300 cubic meters per hour, more than 700 meters deep at the bottom of the well, and the water pressure is equivalent to 700 meters deep at the bottom of the sea."
"If we don't drain the water in time, we will flood the well 10 meters in an hour. We spend almost 85 percent of our time on water control and 15 percent on digging," he said.

In order to overcome geological difficulties such as longitudinal joint development, muddy water inrush and water-rich granite in the No. 1 shaft, the tunnel construction adopts systematic water control measures combining "exploration, injection and excavation" to reduce the construction risk.

After many improvements, the construction of shaft No. 1 formed a mechanized pipeline, such as excavation system, ballast system, suspension system and winch lifting system, which realized the mechanization of the whole process, such as drilling, blasting, ballast, template installation and concrete pouring, and accelerated the construction progress.
Eventually, after more than 1,200 days of construction, the shaft was completed at a depth of 762.59 m.

With a total length of 330 km, it is an important part of the China-Myanmar international corridor and an important transportation infrastructure for the implementation of the "Belt and Road" construction.

When completed, the travel time between Dali and Ruili will be shortened from six hours on the present highway to two hours, which will greatly improve the transportation pattern in the western Yunnan region and promote economic and trade cooperation and people-to-people friendly exchanges between China and the Southeast Asian countries.
As a Chinese, I am proud of my country's achievements
The Hong Kong press welcomes the 70th anniversary of the National Day.
"Hong Kong Press Celebrates the 70th Anniversary of the Founding of the People's Republic of China" held in Hong Kong on 27 July.

Addressing the reception, the Chief Executive of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, Mrs Carrie Lam, said that the achievements of the country over the past 70 years had been witnessed by all the world and we were proud to be Chinese.

Mrs Lam, the Deputy Director of the Liaison Office of the Central Government in Hong Kong, Mr Lu Xinning, the Deputy Commissioner of the Office of the Commissioner of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Hong Kong, Mr Song Ru-an, the Deputy Political Commissar of the People's Liberation Army in Hong Kong, Mr Chen Aden, the Chairman of the Executive Committee of the Preparatory Committee for the National Day Celebration of the Hong Kong Press, Mr Jiang Zhizhong, attended the reception and served as officiating guests.
In her speech, Mrs Lam pointed out that China had made great strides in the past 70 years, and even though it had faced many difficult challenges, it had all overcome them.
Since its return to the motherland, Hong Kong has been closely linked with the Mainland, making progress together and sharing the fruits.

We believe that under the premise of "one country, two systems", Hong Kong can continue to play its advantages in the future and seize the opportunities of the "One Belt, One Road" and the Greater Bay Area to seek a better future for Hong Kong.
She added that every Hong Kong citizen had been affected by the social controversies of the past few months and that journalists faced different challenges.

At this critical juncture, I hope that our friends in the press will continue to rise to the challenge, uphold professionalism, provide fair and balanced news coverage to the community, and contribute to the future of Hong Kong and to the community's return to rational communication and dialogue.
Jiang pointed out in his speech that the glorious history of New China is also the history of Hong Kong and the motherland with development, common progress, consanguinity, honor and disgrace.

Since Hong Kong's return to the motherland in particular, the Central Government has unswervingly implemented the principles of "one country, two systems," "Hong Kong people running Hong Kong" and a high degree of autonomy.
To this end, the Hong Kong press gathered to celebrate the 70th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China.
He said that in the past three months, Hong Kong had witnessed a series of violent activities in flagrant violation of the law and wanton disruption of social stability.
He called on the media to create a good atmosphere for the people to resist violence and uphold the rule of law.

The professional media should strictly abide by the professional standards of journalism, guide the public to be conscious and violent with truthful reporting and responsible speech, and safeguard the justice and majesty of the law.

About 500 people from all walks of life, including the Hong Kong press, attended the reception and joined the officiating guests in raising their glasses to the 70th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China.

British tourist's car keys fall into lake leaving family stranded in France for five days

A Welsh couple taking their two children on a holiday to France recently accidentally dropped their car keys into a lake and the family were forced to wait five days for a new key made by the carmaker.
The couple then left France with their children.
The British family were on a tour of a lake in France on September 16 when their daughter accidentally knocked over a leather bag and dropped the car keys inside, according to reports.
But they spent hours and failed to find the key.
All their belongings and cash were locked in the car.
Despite British tourists buying insurance before departure, insurers refused to help on the grounds that the vehicle was not in danger of being stolen.
They had to hire a trailer to take the car to a garage for storage and reorder the keys from the automaker.
A few days later, the British tourist finally got the keys to the set, and the couple left France with their children.
Their scheduled trip was cancelled due to the loss of their car keys.

Pilot notification of the commitment system in areas such as low-risk food production licenses, and delegation of authority to foreign enterprise representative offices to free trade zones
27, the Shanghai Municipal Market Regulatory Bureau and the Pudong New Area Government signed a working memorandum, introduced 20 market supervision reform measures, some of the first in the country.

According to the introduction, the notification commitment means that the administrative organ will inform the applicant of the conditions and requirements stipulated by the laws and regulations in written form when handling the relevant licensing registration matters.
After the applicant has signed the undertaking, the administrative organ may handle the matter directly.

According to the memorandum, the Shanghai market supervision department will support the Pudong New Area and the Shanghai Free Trade Experimental Zone in the registration of enterprises' names, the processing of food production licenses for simple and low-risk varieties, and the approval of some types of measuring instruments, so as to make the enterprises' access more convenient.
Shanghai Shao Wansheng Food Co. Ltd. on the 27th through the notification of the commitment to obtain the "food production license" on the spot, become the first enterprises to enjoy pilot dividends.

Food permits can also be obtained on the spot, the company's chief executive said, adding that it had adopted a "lack of acceptance" approach, which allowed companies to submit some of their materials within the time limit set by the letter of commitment, and "really felt the benefits of the reform."
Shanghai market supervision authorities said that the implementation of the food production license to inform the commitment system for the country's first pilot.

After the reform, the examination and approval chain was reduced from the previous six links of "registration, acceptance, on-site verification, sample inspection, material examination and approval and certification" to the three links of "registration, acceptance and approval and certification".

In view of the high degree of extroversion of the Pudong economy, the Shanghai market supervision department has delegated the registration of permanent representative offices of foreign (regional) enterprises to the Shanghai Free Trade Area for the convenience of enterprises.
Statistics show that the decentralization involved a total of 1,592 permanent representative offices in the Shanghai Free Trade Area, of which 99 have been handled according to the new regulations.

Dubai Expo 2020 mascot unveiled.
The mascot launch ceremony for the 2020 Dubai World Expo was held in Dubai, United Arab Emirates.
The mascot consists of six cartoon figures, including two Emirati children, three flying robots and an Emirati national tree.
The conference introduced the six mascots to the audience through a video clip.
Rashid, a 9-year-old boy, and Latifah, an 8-year-old girl, are brothers and sisters representing the people of the United Arab Emirates.

The three robots correspond to the three sub-themes of the Expo, with the blue robot representing "mobility", the green robot representing "sustainability", and the yellow robot representing "opportunity".
An ancient chaparral tree has been named "Salama," the "granny" of five "little ones," symbolising the ancestors who guarded the land.

Ahmed, chairman of the Dubai World Expo High Committee, said the mascot could strengthen the emotional connection between the big event and the participants and "believes the mascot of the Dubai World Expo will convey the traditional spirit of storytelling, showcase the creativity of homegrown talent and express our ambitions and expectations."

The launch was attended by the Vice President and Prime Minister of the United Arab Emirates, Sheikh Mohammed of Dubai, Crown Prince Hamdan of Dubai, the State Minister for International Cooperation of the United Arab Emirates and the Director of the Dubai Expo Bureau, Liam Hashemi.
The Dubai World Expo will be held in Dubai from October 20, 2020 to April 10, 2021, with the theme "Communication for the Future."
This will be the first time the Expo will be held in the Middle East.
From next year, Chinese students will be able to apply for German undergraduate degrees on the basis of their university entrance examination results

Starting in 2020, Chinese high school graduates will be able to apply directly for German university degrees on the basis of their college entrance examination results, without having to enroll in a domestic university, the German Anabin database, which evaluates foreign qualifications, announced on its website.

Prior to this, Chinese high school graduates who wanted to apply to German universities were required to study for one semester (211,985 university) or three semesters (regular undergraduate) at home and pass the APS or TestAS exams.
The new rules could save at least half a year for Chinese students who want to study in Germany.
It is understood the new rules will come into force in the second half of 2019.

Applicants are required to: complete 12 years of regular compulsory education and obtain a high school diploma; take the baccalaureate, college entrance examination, and achieve a score of 70% or more of the total score (or more than 525 if the total score is 750), and include two language grades and a grade in mathematics or natural sciences.
In addition, the specific professional requirements for college entrance examination results are not the same.

For example, to apply for a major in Medicine, Oral Medicine, Veterinary Medicine, Pharmacy, etc., the score must be 80% of the full mark, and the subject must include at least two subjects in Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry, and Biology, or take part in an ensemble.
According to incomplete statistics, a number of countries, including Germany, the United Kingdom, Canada, Australia and other countries have recognized China's college entrance examination results.

In the UK, for example, universities such as Cambridge University, Birmingham University and Leicester University accept applications from Chinese students on the basis of their entrance examination results.

State Council Information Office Releases White Paper on China and the World in a New Era

On the occasion of the 70th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China, the Information Office of the State Council released the White Paper "China and the World in a New Era" on 27 July.

Xu Lin, vice minister of the Central Propaganda Department and director of the State Council Information Office, said the white paper systematically introduces China's development achievements, development path and development trend, and elaborates on China's relations with the rest of the world, with a view to enhancing the international community's understanding of China's development.

The white paper says that over the past 70 years, under the leadership of the Communist Party of China (CPC), China has undergone earth-shaking changes and created a miracle of development unprecedented in the history of mankind.
The white paper, with abundant data and facts, gives an account of the great achievements, significance and world contributions China has made in its development over the past 70 years.
The white paper says that China has completed the centuries-old development process of developed countries in a few decades, and its economy ranks second in the world.

The white paper stresses that over the past 70 years, the Chinese people have worked hard and built a new world from scratch; over the past 70 years, China has developed in interaction with the rest of the world, embraced the world, studied the world and contributed to the world; and over the past 70 years, while realizing self-development, China has made contributions to world peace and given impetus to the common development of all countries.

The white paper says that the fundamental reason for the success of China's development over the past 70 years is that under the leadership of the Communist Party of China (CPC), the Chinese people have found the correct path of development for socialism with Chinese characteristics and are firmly following it.

The white paper stresses that the road to socialism with Chinese characteristics is a road established in the light of China's national conditions, a road that puts the interests of the people first, a road of reform and innovation, a road that seeks common development in opening up and a road to rule the country by law in all respects.
This road of development in China is in line with China's national conditions and in line with the requirements of the times.

In response to the international community's concern about China's development, the white paper stresses that achieving national prosperity, national rejuvenation and people's happiness is not only the dream of the Chinese people but also the common dream of people from all over the world.

The white paper points out that China is a major stabilizer and power source of world economic growth.Opening up in all directions will create more opportunities for the development of all countries, provide more public goods for the international community, and provide experience and lessons for other developing countries.

Faced with the question of what is happening to the world and what is to be done by mankind, the white paper points out that the world today is in the midst of a century of unprecedented change and that human society is full of both hope and challenge.
China proposes to build a community of human destiny and open up a new path of cooperation, win-win cooperation and shared development, thus providing new options for human development.

The white paper calls on all countries to unite to build a new type of international relations, promote a new type of economic globalization, safeguard the international system with the United Nations at its core, promote exchanges and mutual learning among civilizations, and work together to build a community of human destiny and a better world.
With the increasing development of China, the international community is concerned about how a developing China can get along with the world.
The white paper says that China cannot develop without the rest of the world, and that China is indispensable to the world's peace, development, prosperity and stability.

China has always placed its own development in the frame of reference for human development.It has always insisted on win-win cooperation and common development, upheld and promoted economic globalization, actively developed global partnership, firmly supported multilateralism, safeguarded international equity and justice, promoted the joint building of "one belt, one road" for high-quality development, actively participated in leading the reform and construction of the global governance system, and always been a builder of world peace, a contributor to global development and a defender of international order.
At present, China's development has entered a new era.

The white paper says that in the new era, China's determination to follow the path of socialism with Chinese characteristics will not change, its determination to learn from each other and cooperate with other countries to achieve win-win results will not change, and its determination to join hands with the rest of the world will not change.
The white paper concludes that, in today's world, the future and destiny of nations have never been more closely linked.
The white paper, China and the World in a New Era, consists of a preface, a text and concluding remarks.
The white paper was published in eight languages, including Chinese, English, French, Russian, German, Spanish, Arabic and Japanese.
Does MCA run a by-election for the parliamentary seat of Tanjung Biai in Johor?

A villager in Baokang County, Hubei Province, who hunted wild animals, was ordered to "patrol the mountain voluntarily"

A villager in Baokang County, Hubei Province, was sentenced for hunting wild animals and ordered to pay 15,420 yuan (RMB, same below) in compensation for the cost of repairing environmental damage to ecological resources.

Due to the indigence of the defendant's family, the procuratorial organs used alternative labor to compensate for the ecological restoration costs, thus realizing the organic unification of legal and social effects.

The defendant, Zhou Mou, had developed deep feelings with wild macaque monkeys and blamed himself for the hunting of animals, said Wang Zhongliang, deputy attorney general of Baokang County Public Prosecutor's Office.

On June 21 this year, the Baokang County Public Prosecutor's Office filed a criminal incidental civil public interest lawsuit in the field of ecological resources, which was heard in public and pronounced in court.

The defendant, Zhou Mou, was sentenced to three years' imprisonment, four years' probation and a fine of 3,000 yuan, and was ordered to pay 15,420 yuan in compensation for damage to the ecological resources and environment.
In late January 2014, Zhou began to build a power grid on the cliffs, hunting more than 20 wild animals, including impala, muntjac, and woolly deer.
The species is listed on the National List of Threatened Species of Wild Animals.
During the trial, Zhou confessed to his illegal facts and actions and was willing to bear the incidental civil liability.

However, in view of the poor economic situation of Zhou's family, under the coordination of the Baokang County Prosecutor's Office, the local village committee, forest station and Zhou Mou reached an agreement on alternative labor compensation for ecological restoration costs: namely, Zhou Mou provided public services to offset the ecological restoration costs by carrying out macaque domestication and conservation work in the village macaque reserve, voluntary mountain patrol and forest protection for one year.

In response to the prosecutor's recommendation, the court said it accepted Zhou's execution of the probation, while actively fulfilling the obligation of "alternative labor compensation for ecological restoration costs."
At present, Zhou Mou has been in the macaque reserve for three months of voluntary labor, active mountain patrol, good performance.

In recent years, the Baokang County procuratorate has integrated the procuratorial functions and social governance in practice, scientifically applying such supervision methods as procuratorial advice, investigation supervision and lawsuit supervision to minimize damage to the ecological environment caused by criminal acts through judicial means.
UN awards Earth Defender Award for "Ant Forest"

To rapturous applause and loud music, Xu Di, the director of the Ant Forest project, and Shen Junliang, the user representative, took the podium and took the 2019 United Nations Champions of the Earth award from the host.

The "Ant Forest" project, which uses mobile phone programs to engage hundreds of millions of people in environmental action, was awarded the "Inspiration and Action Award" at the 2019 Champions of the Earth Awards in New York City.
The United Nations Environment Programme announced the winners a week ago at its headquarters in the Kenyan capital, Nairobi.

"Ant Forest is an exciting innovation that allows hundreds of millions of people to act to understand the environmental challenges facing humanity and what it can do for the environment," UNEP Executive Director Yingluck Ansheng told Xinhua.
It uses technology to connect people and the environment, allowing every individual to participate in actions to protect the planet, which will have a huge impact.

Ant Forest was launched in August 2016 by the Ant Financial Services Group of China (Ant Gold) on the Alipay platform, where users save "green energy" by recording their daily green trips in the "Ant Forest", paying for water and electricity online, and "planting trees" on their mobile phones.
For every virtual tree that users cultivate, "ant forests" and pro bono partners plant a real tree in desertified areas.
By August this year, 500 million "ant forest" users had accumulated a carbon reduction of 7.92 million tons and planted 122 million trees in desertified areas.
Costa Rica's president, Carlos Alvarado, praised the "ant forest" for its "impressive ability to inspire so many people to take part in green action".
Jing Xiandong, Ant's chairman and chief executive, said the award was a recognition of the Ant Forest project.
Technology and open platforms make it possible for everyone to participate in a low-carbon life, an honour that belongs to all participants.

Mr Jing said the “ant forests ” had affected 500 million people in the past three years and the goal for the next three years was to engage 1 billion people around the world in low-carbon initiatives.
While combating desertification and protecting the environment, they are also exploring ways to make farmers earn more from green mountains and rivers.

In addition to providing employment opportunities through tree planting, it is also hoped to help farmers increase their incomes through agricultural product development projects, electricity trading platforms, etc.
"Ant Forest" based on the digital technology of the public good environmental model has also been successful out to sea, for other countries.
In June, GCash, the Philippines' largest e-wallet, launched the Philippine version of "Ant Forest," encouraging Filipino users to better protect the environment through low-carbon living.

GCash, along with the Philippine Department of Environment and Natural Resources and environmental advocacy groups, plans to plant 365,000 trees in the Philippines within a year of the project's launch.
The Champions of the Earth Award is the highest award given annually by the United Nations in the field of environmental protection.

The "Ant Forest" award is the third consecutive year that a green innovation project from China has won the "Inspiration and Action Award", following the "Thousand Village Demonstration and Wancun Remediation" project in Zhejiang Province, China, and the construction of Saihanba Forest Farm.
Economic and trade frictions affect the U. S. economic "report card".
The report card for the US economy for the second quarter of this year shows that GDP growth slowed sharply from the previous quarter, hurt by a sharp drop in private-sector investment and exports.
Analysts pointed to economic and trade frictions and the resulting uncertainty as the main reasons for the drop in private sector investment and exports in the second quarter.

The Commerce Department ’ s final revision, released on the 26th, showed that US GDP grew at an annualized rate of 2% in the second quarter, about the same as the previous revision, but well below the 3.1% rate in the first quarter.
The data showed that consumption growth was the main factor underpinning US economic growth in the second quarter.
Personal consumption spending, which accounts for about 70% of the US economy, grew by 4.6% in the quarter, boosting growth by 3.03 percentage points.
In addition, government consumer spending and investment contributed 0.82 percentage points to economic growth.

However, private-sector investment fell 6.3% in the second quarter from the previous quarter, dragging down growth by 1.16 percentage points; exports fell 5.7% from the previous quarter, and net exports dragged down growth by 0.68 percentage points.

Barry Knapp, managing partner of Ainslie Macroeconomic Consulting, said private sector investment had not only failed to maintain last year's growth momentum, but had fallen sharply as economic friction and rising uncertainty hit business confidence.
Mr Knapp believes US corporate capital spending is still expected to fall next year amid policy uncertainty.

Analysts said that while consumption growth provided a strong support for the US economy in the second quarter, there were growing signs that economic and trade frictions and the uncertainty they created had dented consumer confidence and adversely affected the outlook for US consumption.

In a recent survey, 38 percent of consumers spontaneously mentioned the negative impact of tariffs on the U.S. economy, a year-and-a-half high, said Richard Curtin, an economics professor at the University of Michigan who led the survey.
As for the future of the U.S. economy, analysts generally expect it to continue to slow.
But some experts say the performance of both the U.S. industrial sector and financial markets will improve if economic and trade frictions ease.

Kathleen Birch, a global economist at the Economist Intelligence Unit, expects the US economy to continue its gradual downward trend this year, with growth falling to even lower levels than in the second quarter.
Mark Zandi, chief economist at Moody ’ s Analytics, predicts that the US economy will grow by 2.3% this year, assuming economic friction does not escalate, and will slow further to 1.6% next year.
According to Ellen Harzen, investment manager at Putnam Investments, the biggest concern for companies today is economic and trade disputes and the uncertainty they create.
Economic and trade frictions remain the "primary issue" and the main cause of this year's volatility in U.S. capital markets, said Matt Meley, equity strategist at Miller-Tabak Asset Management.
Ningxia initiates joint parental leave of 10 days per year for parents of children aged 0 to 3
Safeguarding the legitimate rights and interests of women is the embodiment of respecting and safeguarding human rights and an important symbol of social civilization and progress.

On September 27, at the 15th Session of the Standing Committee of the 12th National People's Congress of the Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region, the Regulations on the Protection of the Rights and Interests of Women in the Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region were adopted by a high vote.
This is the first local regulation enacted at the provincial level in Ningxia to comprehensively and systematically safeguard the legitimate rights and interests of women.

As far as we know, the Regulations were revised on the basis of the Measures for the Implementation of the Law of the People's Republic of China on the Protection of the Rights and Interests of Women in Ningxia in 2007, and are divided into nine chapters and 65 articles, including general provisions, political rights, cultural and educational rights and interests, labor and social security rights and interests, property rights and interests, personal rights, marriage and family rights and interests, legal responsibilities and supplementary provisions.
In the Regulations, Ningxia encouraged the exploration of joint parental leave, the first of its kind in the country.

In April this year, the General Office of the State Council issued the Guidance on Promoting the Development of Care Services for Children under the Age of 3, which contains a description of joint parenting.

In the course of revising the Regulations, Ningxia made an innovative proposal to "encourage employing units to grant joint parental leave of ten days each year to both spouses during the period of zero to three years for couples who have children in accordance with laws and regulations."
At the same time, the Regulations highlight the fight against sexual harassment and the protection of female minors.

Article 43 of the Regulations incorporates the latest legislative achievements in the compilation of the personality rights in China's current Civil Code, detailing the constituent elements of sexual harassment and the body and mechanism for combating sexual harassment.

Article 44 of the Ordinance explicitly prohibits the frequent sexual abuse of girls and requires educational institutions to carry out educational, protective and preventive work, which is a new benchmark for the protection of girls in local legislation.

With regard to women's right to know and dispose of the common property of marriage and family, article 35 of the Regulations clearly stipulates women's right to know about the common property and the obligations of property registration agencies and related subjects, providing solid institutional support for women's rights protection.

In addition, article 26 of the Regulations not only prohibits direct discrimination but also prohibits indirect discrimination in relation to gender discrimination in employment, and draws on the latest practical experience of joint interviews to strengthen the discipline for violations of gender discrimination and strengthen the protection of the legitimate rights and interests of women.

In recent years, the Ningxia Women's Federation's Joint Department of Public Prosecutions and Law, Civil Affairs and other departments have promoted and introduced social and professional forces to participate in the mediation of marital and family conflicts and the fight against domestic violence.

The Regulations summarize and promote this issue, and several laws encourage the mobilization of social forces and the accumulation of social resources for the joint protection of women's rights and interests, and require people's governments at and above the county level to provide stable and institutional protection and support through the purchase of services.
Academician Yuan Longping of Inner Mongolia Xing UNITA workstation salt-tolerant alkali rice paddy per mu yield

Journalist 27 from the Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region Xing UNITA administrative office learned that the "Xing UNITA Yuan Longping Academician workstation salt-tolerant rice field inspection and acceptance of the production of good news", the average salt-tolerant rice per mu paddy more than 1000 jin.

A team of six experts from the Heilongjiang Academy of Agricultural Sciences, Yangzhou University and Hunan Provincial Agricultural and Rural Affairs Department sampled and harvested rice from the "Xing Salt Series".
After expert assessment, the salt-tolerant rice yields 508.8 kg of rice per mu on land with a pH of 8.8 to 9.6 and a salinity of 5 to 6 per thousand.

"We plan to innovate and reform the salt-tolerant rice varieties on the basis of this year's experiment," said Wang Shigang, executive station chief of Xing UNITA's Yuan Longping Academician Workstation.

"On the premise that the factors of production remain the same, I think that by continuing to strengthen scientific and technological efforts, salt-tolerant rice will continue to produce miracles on saline soil," said Lai Yongcai, vice president and researcher of the Heilongjiang Academy of Agricultural Sciences, who is also the head of the expert group.
Xing UNITA belongs to the southern foothills of the Daxing'an Mountains concentrated in the area of special hardship.
In October 2018, the Yuan Longping Academician Workstation was unveiled by UNITA.

Prof. Yuan Longping led a team of experts to speed up the introduction and popularization of the latest salt-tolerant hybrid rice varieties and advanced technology, and to build a 960 mu salt-tolerant rice base in Korqin's right flank.

The field test of salt-alkali tolerant rice not only provides scientific basis for raising the salt-alkali middle and low-yield fields of XingUNITA to inject hope into the middle and high-yield fields, but also provides scientific basis for rice cultivation in saline-alkali fields under the same conditions in China.
After marathon debates and weeks of protests, the new Australian state passed the abortion decriminalisation bill on September 26, local time, according to AusNet.
It is understood the bill has sparked political debate in the past eight weeks, with deep divisions within the Liberal Party since it was introduced by independent MPs in Greenwich.
After nearly 40 hours of discussion, the Senate voted 26 to 14 to legalize abortion, making it the third-longest-running bill in the Senate.
26, the morning after a final vote in the House of Representatives to legalize abortion in the new state.
The bill allows women to terminate a pregnancy at 22 weeks of gestation if two doctors agree, and also allows women to have an abortion later in the pregnancy.

The Senate on the 25th night passed an amendment allowing doctors to seek advice from a multidisciplinary panel of the hospital advisory committee before performing an abortion on a woman after 22 weeks of pregnancy.
In addition, the amendments passed by the Senate also include the requirement that doctors provide appropriate care for babies who survive after termination of pregnancy.

Previously facing public criticism from conservatives over the bill, the new state governor, Berejiklian, stepped in several times to secure more debate time for the bill, but she was not present for the final vote.
"I need to take the time to run the whole new state," he said, defending his absentee ballot.
Davis, the Liberal MP, is understood to have been the strongest opponent of the abortion bill, threatening to withdraw from the new state government, saying the bill caused a "crisis in government".
But then Davis relented.
"The content of the amendment to the bill legalizing abortion that was presented to the House on the morning of the 26th actually provides additional safeguards for women, doctors," Davis said.
Meanwhile, NSW National Party leader Barry Rau said he was proud to be part of a government that decriminalised abortion.
"What we achieved last night is historic for the new state, which decriminalizes abortion, decriminalizes abortion and does not treat women who have abortions as criminals," he said.
